Our issue was primarily the dinner after our waiter did not return to our table another waiter came over and said he'd be handling our table even though our original waiter had taken on a larger party not far from us. My sister and my cousin both got the same dish which is the Linguine Cicale which is supposed to include Wide linguine with shrimp scallops calamari & mussels. The dish had no scallops no shrimp one muscle shell and the meat was missing inside of it. The dish was smothered in just calamari. Before they could say anything about it the 2nd waiter left our table never came to check on us the entire time we were eating so you couldn't say anything about the dish. The next time we saw someone it was the bus clearing the table. At $28 a dish the Il Cortile should be ashamed of what they served them. My mom's dinner at $20 was 4 ravioli in a plate. Overall relatively low value & terrible service for what we spent.

name: JuanC
review_content: Coming back to IL Cortile from Seattle a second year and it was just as fantastic if not better than the first time my wife and I were there. Frank waited our table again and was very very good at helping us make our minds up. His service is simply superb! See you again soon IL Cortile.      God Bless!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Our waiter was Angelo and he made our Meal much more pleasant. He was very accommodating with any substitutions on the meal. His answer was always. I will do for you signora. Great atmosphere and such a pleasant staff. Every server that came to our table met us with a smile.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We didn't sit in the garden room where we have always been seated before because there was a singer and we were with friends and knew we would be talking.  Outside the garden room it is rather plain and really loud however it was a Friday night.  The food was AMAZING! I ordered Pasta Carbonara which was not on the menu but was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had the pleasure of eating! Everything we ordered was excellent but that pasta was a star!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Bad service and mediocre food. Restrooms were not clean

name: KelvinD
review_content: Great experience. Staff were excellent. Food was delicious. We were there on Friday night so we're able to enjoy excellent entertainment. This will be on our favorites list going forward.

name: Lois
review_content: Excellent food and ambiance.  Server could have been a little more attentive.  Eating in "courtyard" area gave outdoor feel without the heat.

name: BrendaB
review_content: I've been going to this restaurant since it opened over 40 years ago but it had been 12 years since my last visit.  We took our daughter and her friend for a birthday dinner and we were so delighted and impressed that it still had the same excellent food and service we remembered.  I cannot recall how many people I've told about Il Cortile over the years but the word from me will continue to spread in the hopes this fine establishment will continue to thrive for decades to come.  Thank you!

name: DWBA
review_content: Great food without NYC prices in NYC.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The food and service was excellent as always.  If I have time for dinner in NYC I always choose Il Cortile. The best.

name: richardw
review_content: I try to visit Il Cortile whenever I come to NY from Virginia. Everything was wonderful. My only disappointment was that Veal Valdastana was not one of the specials that evening.

name: CarrieC
review_content: Absolutely FANTASTIC restaurant! Friendly staff delicious/authentic Italian food! Highly recommend!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Simply Awesome!!

name: Rootdoc
review_content: I've been there before.  Very large space with separate rooms.  All with great atmosphere.  I prefer the courtyard.  Had great service and very good traditional "Red Sauce" fare.  The only complaint I have is the the wine list was terrible.  Very few selections.  I couldn't believe how sparse the selection was. I think Olive Garden would even have a better list.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Both my friend and I love saying that we would enjoy going back and we did in fact go back I was really nice delicious reasonable authentic dining experience

name: michameow
review_content: Really enjoyed our visit last week.  Great atmosphere and nice staff.  I just wished they offered more vegetarian options.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great service and fantastic food. Really enjoyed our date night dinner

name: CandA
review_content: Tourist trap. Soggy and tasteless pasta dishes. We had three different pasta dishes and none was what to expect from an Italian restaurant.

name: OpenTableMan
review_content: I wanted to go to Little Italy for dinner. Along the street there are many shops offering outdoor dining - just like in the streets of any Italian city. I picked this one based on a friend's recommendation. As you enter it's like going to Italy. The entire staff is speaking Italian. The food is very authentic. And the service is very sincere. I would like to go back. But then I'd also like to try some other restaurants along that street.The nice part they are very accomodating on food preparation - most dishes can be prepared 'vegetarian'.

name: MirandaC
review_content: Such a beautiful space. The food was lovely and the service was top notch. Highly recommend.

name: JSOR
review_content: Lovely ambiance great service and extensive menu. We had four different meals and all were good. Portions were huge and could be shared. The desserts were especially nice but probably not made at the restaurant. Bread basket was not appealing...very hard and dry breadsticks that were not eatable. However a comfortable dinner in a attractive restaurant.

name: Jollyroger
review_content: We had a group of 11 and the staff accommodated us in the wonderful atrium.  Great food and great service!!

name: MartinK
review_content: We have been customers of Il Cortile since 1988 when we discovered this gem in the middle of Little Italy. Being frequent tourists to NYC whether with family or friends Il Cortile has not disappointed any of us. The quality and choices of food drinks fresh bread reasonable prices and the ambiance accentuated by the most personable yet unobtrusive attention from the camerrieri namely Angelo make this spot a must on our every trip to the Big Apple. Grazie!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The food was delicious.  The only complaint we have is that my husband's dinner which was the pasta which (I think they called it Sunday sauce) was supposed to have a meatball a sausage and a bracciole. Well the bracciole was missing and when he asked the waiter he was told that it was in there. Clearly it wasn't and when the waiter asked the chef the chef said they were all out of it.  I'm thinking they left it out because they were out of it so telling my husband that they gave it to him when they did not was just not true. We wouldn't say it wasn't in there if it was! He actually ordered that particular dish because he was in the mood for bracciole!! Anyway other than that it was a nice evening.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Our second visit to il Cortile the dining choice of the cast of The Sopranos! It‚Äôs a fabulous all round experience great buzz super food and super service a Little Italy must eat!

name: mdniotta
review_content: Authentic excellent food and service! The restaurant reminds me of a place where my Italian relatives bring their families to for Sunday dinner.

name: Lzksu
review_content: Family visiting

review_content: Amazing service food and ambiance. What a fun place to have many types of events! If ever back in NYC we will find this place again..worth the steps to get there!

name: Nafpakt01

name: OpenTable Diner

name: DCinATL
review_content: This restaurant is classic old-school Italian.  The service is excellent and the food is very good.  One person in our party was a vegetarian.  With the exception of a couple of appetizers and one entree special there were very few vegetarian options.

name: Greeneyedkzin
review_content: I have been going to Il Cortile for almost 20 years now and it is probably my favorite place in Little Italy: traditional gracious and filled with tasty food served expertly and with warm hospitality.Even at 5:30 (we arrived early) the courtyard had filled with people I think were local and know a good thing when they have one. The place accommodated couples and families: even the children were composed and happy. Portions are huge. Two people can split an antipasto  while I don't know how anyone gets through antipasto pasta entree and dessert. I had the Sunday "gravy" which is tasty and more of a stew with meatballs sausage and ribs the flavor seeping into the rigatoni. Also ordered was veal and my friend couldn't finish that either. We barely had enough room for espresso and macchiato respectively.The manager and waiters are old-school and very courteous dinner was leisurely in beautiful surroundings. I'm already looking forward to going back.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: please disregard the bad reviews but responses mandatory. I did not eat at IC.please see my private note below

name: jrobins913
review_content: Excellent Italian food with really good home-made pasta.  The Napoleon was awesome!

name: LGood

name: GregD

name: Cobra

name: Leenie
review_content: Il Cortile has been a very special place for us to celebrate holidays and special occasions for the past 20 years. The food is consistently great offers excellent service and the staff is very personable.  By far Il Cortile is the best restaurant in Little Italy.

name: MichaelW

name: JonS

review_content: Second visit in the last 4 years and waitstaff should seriously mind their own business and not comment on one's dinner date. Completely disrespectful. This happened four years ago thought it was an aberration then again last week so apparently they have no clue.

name: opentablediner
review_content: Came here on a previous trip to New York in 2010 with the family and decided to try it again at the end of 2016 and it did not disappoint. Sole was really good Waiter was great putting together whatever we wanted - daughter wanted shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta no problem. Seems like it is one of the last traditional places in Little Italy as Chinatown expnds into it so go now!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Good italian food - nice restaurant and good service

name: dennisf
review_content: Excellent food and great service in Little Italy

name: Catsmeow22
review_content: We had a 7 pm reservation and they first told us it would be 15 minutes until our table was ready. O.K. reasonable.....After 15 minutes passed we were told it would be twenty more.  Well not so happy!Then we were told after that twenty that it would be another 40 minutes!!!!At that point we left. We went across the street to a restaurant that was more than happy to have our business and seated us promptly.  There were many people there in our same position.  I think that they just kept taking reservations without even thinking of honoring them.  The host was very unfriendly about the entire situation.  Cannot comment on the food since we couldn't eat there.  The man at the front outside told us to wait at the bar and have a drink while waiting  and when we went inside we were told there was no bar! Major miscommunication? Had he never been in there? Very strange.  I have to say I have never been anywhere where the wait time expanded rather than going in the opposite direction.  Needless to say we will not be dining there anytime soon.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I booked a reservation for Christmas Day on a whim having never been to Il Cortile before & can honestly say it was one of the best decisions I've made all year! The food service hospitality and ambiance of this place blew my expectations out of the water. The Ragu del Macellaio (Sunday Sauce) with Cavatelli was perfection right down to the fresh whole basil leaves. Each & every bite brought back memories of many past Christmas dinners with my family eating the exact same meal.Il Cortile will definitely be on my bucket list the next time I find myself in New York. And to all of you reading this you need some Il Cortile in your life! This place is the real deal and they totally do it right. Buon Natale!

name: Jeanph
review_content: The location is wonderful very festive feeling for the holidays. We went for Christmas dinner and it was very crowded and we had to wait a bit  all good signs of a great restaurant everybody wanted to eat there. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was superb. This is our second time here and we will be back!

name: Chalkitup
review_content: Five of us met for Christmas Day dinner so of course it was quite crowded.  Service was unusually slow and we waited almost 45 minutes luckily we had a large bread basket.  When we finally asked our food appeared a minute later.   Waiter was very apologetic and we enjoyed everything although I wouldn't say the food is worth going out of the way for.  Ambiance was exceptional -- we were in the atrium and it was decorated for Christmas and there were little lights everywhere.

name: Dfoodie
review_content: Awesome Italian food and great service! Accommodated 17 people on Christmas Eve.   Would definitely go back next time we are in NYC

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Such a lovely experience from start to finish! Unbelievably friendly and attentive wait staff (Angelo!) not to mention the delectable food! Lobster ravioli was a party in my mouth. As was the veal scaloponi and the meatballs. Mmmmmmm

name: RMRM
review_content: Fantastic dining experience.  I have dined here before and as usual the food was the best Italian in the City.  The wait staff and owner of the restaurant provided the kids a great dining experience.

name: JosephP
review_content: My party and I ate at Il Cortile about a week before Christmas.  The other members of the party had been here before and go here whenever they are in Lower Manhattan.  However the meal left me wondering why anyone would forego patronizing the countless  Italian restaurants in the city to eat here.  The service was fine although the process of paying the check took a bit longer than it should have.  The restaurant tries to capture dining "al fresco" with the indoor plants and the ceiling window.  However it seems a bit dated and bit cramped.  The food was disappointing.  The Asiago Stuffed Mushrooms were fine and easily the best thing served to us.  The Caesar Salad was noticeably overdressed.  The dressing practically acted as an adhesive sticking the various leaves of Romaine together.  The flavor wasn't terrible the unpleasing texture and balance rendered it unappetizing.  The Linguini Cicale was poorly executed.  The scallops and shrimp were cooked well.  However the calamari which overwhelmed the dish due it being over portioned was rubbery and flavorless (as was the pasta).  The flavor ended up on the bottom of the bowl since it clearly wasn't tossed with the pasta prior to plating.  Overall the restaurant isn't horrible.  There are just many better places in NYC (and Little Italy) from which to choose).

name: alan
review_content: Old school. Still one of the best Italian food restaurants. In little Italy and around a long time. Worth the trip.

name: Gwolff

name: LMW2

review_content: Met some out of town friends here for dinner and it was a beautiful experience.  Their lobster ravioli was a MAJOR hit with those that ordered it. review_content: Il Cortile is one of the better Little Italy restaurants.  Food was very good.  Staff was friendly and very accommodating.  It has s large comfortable waiting area which can be very important on a cold night.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The food and service was fabulous! Have been there many times ! Love this place !

name: OpenTable Diner

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Food quality and size of the menu are very good there's probably better food in the city but the value for the price is excellent. There are plenty of the standards and a few playful dishes as well. My girlfriend wanted Veal francese which was not on the menu but they immediately obliged us after we asked if it could be made. The portion sizes were very large for her dish and mine was adequate. The quality of the food itself was excellent for the price range. They have an amazing dessert menu with Bombas Cannolis and Tiramisu and many others. The interior is wonderful we had a lunch date in the garden room which is very comfortable and beautiful with the plants and light cascading down from the skylight. There are many other rooms and each looks well appointed and interesting there is also a small outside area if you desire to people watch or enjoy the view of little Italy. The staff were amazing behaving as a first class staff despite the less expensive nature of the restaurant. It's a bunch of mostly Italian guys consummate professionals. They are unobtrusive and allow you the time to enjoy your meal. Overall a wonderful experience.

name: skos
review_content: went there to celebrate a 40th bday and found this place to still be the best in Little Italy.They didn't have lasagna on the menu but the waiter arranged it for me . Place which go the extra distance are special!

name: LTKK
review_content: Simply delicious! Wanted an authentic Italian meal and this was above all expectations. The courtyard is beautiful  and service exceptional.  Many places in Little Italy to eat but this should be your 1st and only go-to spot!

name: Michael
review_content: Restaurant is very classy  the garden is very tranquil and pretty . We went there for the "Power Lunch" during San Genaro fair and we were told that they do not have the "Power Lunch" price during the fair we told them that we will just go somewhere else and then they gave us the "Power Lunch" pricing. Food is very good  but the service was spotty but for the "Power lunch" menu it's a good choice.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The only negative about this place was not being seated until an hour after our reservation time.

name: Geh1
review_content: The food and service was excellent. We had to wait a little but it was fine since we were in no rush.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Went here on a Saturday evening during the Feast to have a meal that I knew would impress the out of towners we had with us and give them a wonderful taste of Little Italy. name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Every time I visit NYC  I plan to eat at least one meal at Il Cortile...and I'm never disappointed by the atmosphere the fantastic food and great service. The two gentlemen who greet and seat the patrons are fun to watch as they truly seem to enjoy making sure theirs guest are treated with care. I truly LOVE this place!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: this is one of my favorite stops in Lil Italy.  the food and the service is OUTSTANDING.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Perfect food great prosseco and pasta waiter very polite and we sat just in tony soprano desk !

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: 2 of us got the veal parm. it was very tender and delicious ! the other 2 got a pasta /veggie dishand also enjoyed theirs. their sauce/gravy is very good. Just be careful of the "lunch" menu.  There was a very reasonably priced lunch menu posted on their posts outside but when we sat down the guy standing outside pushing people to eat at their restaurant handed us their dinner menu although it was about 2:10 in the afternoon and the lunch special ran till 4:00.  Upon seeing our confusion while reading the dinner menu he came over and asked us if we would rather see the lunch menus.  Seemed to us like they try and pull a fast one when they can.   Other than that our experience was a very nice it was a beautiful day (Sept. 22nd)  during the Italian festival so we sat outside and enjoyed.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Good Italian restaurant in Little Italy. My go to during the San Genaro festival. Service is ok food is great & ambience is nice.

name: david
review_content: To be fair to Il Cortile there was a street fair going on that we were unaware of at the time we booked our reservation.  The street fair took up the entire Mulberry street (countless blocks).  it took us an additional half hour to get to the restaurant as the taxi couldn't even get close.They had a limited menu and a limited wine list for the evening (and very inflated prices).  I had asked the manager if we could have the regular wine list and he said no they were only offering the limited list.  I figured this was because they had a bottle of Amarone listed at $175.  I looked it up and could get it from a wine shop for $48.  This kind of put me in a bad mood.  Anyway back to the food.  The manager waited on us.  We had a couple apps and they were pretty good. Stuffed mushrooms and calamari.  The apps came out pretty fast and were pretty good.  our entrees were ok too.  I had a stuffed filet.  It wasn't stuffed.  The cheese stuffing was just placed on top.  The steak was a bit under cooked but as they were slammed and it took an hour to get our entrees I didn't send it back (or ask to have it heated up as the sauce was room temp).  Every one seemed to enjoy their meals so i was the odd one out.  One of our friends had been there 3 weeks prior and raved about it so it really must have been due to the festival.We will give them another try (and make sure there isn't going to be a special menu or a festival going on).

name: scotch
review_content: Went during San Gennaro feast and waited hour & a half for entrees after timely apps. Hoping it was just that the kitchen was slammed. Food was fantastic. Would go back to try again in hopes they serve quicker. Outside during the feast was soooo much fun. It's a definite must do if you have good company to talk to while u wait!

name: RRRDFW
review_content: The quintessential Little Italy experience. Great food good and reasonable wine list a rarity in NYC. Hosts and servers are welcoming and appreciative.

name: NJTom
review_content: Was there for San Gennaro.  Sat outside as requested and got to enjoy watching the mass of humanity walk by.  Even though the menu was limited there was a broad selection.  Appetizers and entrees were excellent.  The staff tried their best to keep up with the crowd.  A definite favorite.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great Authentic Italian cuisine served in a quaint setting in Little Italy NYC.The waiters were attentive an served our food in a timely fashion. Our reservation allowed us to be seated immediately even during the very busy San Gennaro Festival. We enjoyed our meal and the ambiance.

name: Marybeth
review_content: One of my all time favorite places great food and friendly staff

name: AUGUSTUSC
review_content: Was outstanding. Romantic evening with a beautiful table outside on Mulberry Street people watching.

name: Chris
review_content: Il Cortile is a fine choice for a romantic date before a show. It's among other Italian restaurants in the Little Italy neighborhood. We were seated right away at a private nook near the front of the restaurant next to the wine cabinet. Our server kept coming over to tend our table keep our wine glasses topped and serve us tasty Italian dishes. We both got a rigatoni dish my date with red sauce and mine with a cream sauce both excellent.

name: NewYorkLady
review_content: I believe that people are entitled to have fun when they go out...but there were two tables that were screaming so loud we had to move our table to the front by the window.   These two tables were allowed to take over a rather large dining room and disrupted everyone else's experience.

name: Allank
review_content: Excellent next time I would request a table outside.  That would make this experience perfect on a nice night. I will be back with a large group again!   Allan K.

name: NYCJean
review_content: As usual the food was great tasty and well presented.  I found the seating in the atrium area a little noisy and had a little difficulty hearing the conversation which I never had in the front area.   This is our go to restaurant for entertaining guests from out of town.  Never lets us down.

name: jkroth
review_content: We booked a reservation at the last minute based on Trip Advisor reviews and we very much enjoyed it. I am gluten free and they offer 2 types of gluten free pasta so I could choose from several dishes on the menu which was a nice surprise! Service was fantastic and our server was great about accommodating my needs and helping our kids select items they would enjoy. It was busy and vibrant the food was great and we had a fabulous experience. It was expensive in our view but it is NYC...

name: RickC
review_content: Outstanding food and service! Dinner espesso and deserts were excellent!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We were celebrating a birthday and this restaurant was suggested at the hotel. They were right!!Service could not be better food delicious and the ambience was great!!Thanks to all!!!

name: LANY
review_content: Been here a ziillion times. Don't go a hot day! I had to fight to get the air on which they kept turning off. Server brought the wrong order after a long wait. I told my guest to start without me. They mean well can't always pull it off. It's basic stuff in the history heart of it all. Nice to walk around after dinner. Do get dessert across the street and any number of excellent shops.

name: Tshed
review_content: The service and food was excellent! Very nice staff and quick servers. Always there filling up our water. Could use a few more value bottles of red $40 or so on the wine menu.The food quality and location is great! Thanks again!

name: BarbM
review_content: We booked Il Cortile for a family celebration in honor of my father's 80th birthday.    It was hard to choose a restaurant since my family is Italian and my father is a wonderful Italian chef himself - so the pressure was on to find a place that would impress him.   As it turned out Vincenzo and his staff did not disappoint!  Upon hearing both my parents and my aunt and uncle compliment the Ragu del Macellaio I know we had chosen well. That's saying something since we have grown up with some pretty fantastic Ragu recipes in the family! The entire meal was delicious - starting with the family style appetizers pasta for the next course followed by some chicken and veal scallopine and then Vincenzo's amazing gelatto for dessert.  I especially appreciated Vincenzo's suggestions and advice on the food choices.  Overall we had three generations of family who all agreed that the experience was wonderful and I would highly recommend Il Cortile for good authentic Italian food.

name: KarenF
review_content: The ambiance was perfect for a trip to Little Italy New York from San Diego California. We were celebrating our mom's birthday and wanted atmosphere...elegance and family! The owner stopped by the table to check on us and our waiter Francesco was so observant and attentive. We had a wonderful evening...just wish I could have had more room for that deliciously fresh pasta!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Have been going here for years - never disappointed!  Lovely atmosphere - fabulous Italian food - great option for personal or business dining.  Nice waiters and friendly.

name: Jerry
review_content: The food was great.  Service ambiance decor were excellent.  Nice wine selection full bar.I had scallops and they were cooked to perfection  family members ordered veal and chicken scallopine also good choices.  Appetizers we had fried calamari and zucchini we would highly recommend.

name: JenniferC
review_content: We want a delicious Italian meal and Il Cortile was fabulous!  From the burrato to the pasta to the Dream Bomba for dessert it was all delicious!

name: CarolG
review_content: Food was amazing. Everything was so fresh and delicious. The service was excellent.  They didn't rush us and we had a good time.  Would definitely go back.

name: KarenM
review_content: Have eaten at Il Cortile a number of times over the years.  Really a let down this time. Ambiance is gone.  A bit dirty.Food and service was very good but not worth the trip to Little Italy from mid-town. We were sad...

name: Dash
review_content: The food was good and the service was acceptable but the menu was missing many traditional Italian dishes

name: KaseyC
review_content: We've been patrons of il Cortile since the late 70s.  It has certainly lost its appeal.  Apparently there is a new chef who is from Equador.  The food no longer reflects the true Italian tradition.We more than likely will not return.

name: PandJ
review_content: Food was excellent as usual.  I miss the tablecloths!

name: RaymondE
review_content: Great spot.  Come hungry.  Patio has A/C and is very charming.  Gives you the feel of Little Italy.  Food is authentic and well prepared.  Classy clientele.  Good waiter.

name: Bobby
review_content: nothing even remotely memorable about this place. very disappointed.

name: MarieB
review_content: Our first visit to Il Cortile was 36 years ago when my husband and I got engaged. With living in other states and having children we were not able to get back.  36 years later it was just as wonderful as the first time.  We hope to get back again much sooner!

name: BillP
review_content: We were in the city to see Wicked on Broadway. I wanted a good Italian restaurant in Little Italy to bring my family for dinner. Il Cortile was a perfect place to bring my family after the show for a great Italian meal good wine and a very relaxed atmosphere. We did not feel rushed and had a very enjoyable experience. I would definitely visit Il Cortile again!

name: Cntrltxn
review_content: Typical Little Italy pasta with a beautiful brick atrium dining area in back. Really enjoyed the meatball & ricotta cheese appetizer special.

name: Margaret
review_content: Very good food and service.  You won't be disappointed.

name: ChristineS
review_content: The food was fantastic.  The service was excellent.  I would recommend to family and firiends.

name: OwenB
review_content: What a great experience.  This was my daughter's first NYC/Little Italy experience and this was our first "real" meal on the trip.  GREAT way to start our vacation.  The food was great the staff was exceptional and the views while in the dining room are great.  Just a great great experience.

name: Hatguy
review_content: Il Cortile is an institution in Little Italy we have frequented  for more than 20 years! The food is always very good & this past Monday evening our server Frank surpassed our expectations!

name: ElisaT
review_content: I was very disappointed with our evening at Il Cortile. I had asked for a courtyard table remembering (last time I've been in was 1975-76) that the courtyard was beautiful with brick facades and excellent floral touches everywhere. Instead it looked like it was under construction and a lot of the brick had been covered up.It seems like there has been at least one change of ownership since then because they did not take pride at all in the way the meal was served. We had brought a bottle of wine with us thinking we could open it with a corkage fee but when we found out the fee was $50 it was clear they wanted to send us a strong message. The food was average and we were parked next to a table of about 15-20 people where we couldn't even hear each other talk!Never again. Clearly they don't care about anyone's dining experience here.

name: IrwinK
review_content: The food was  very good. The d√©cor was nice . The service was very friendly.

name: ElaineNYC
review_content: This classic Italian in the shrinking Little Italy neighborhood is better than ever. The choices are varied the prices not low but not over the top and the service was professional and helpful. My friend and I were interested in sharing our two main courses and without our asking the waiter had the entrees divided and plated in the kitchen so we each had on our plates half of both entrees.  Nicely done.

name: WesA
review_content: As usual Il Cortile did not disappoint. The staff is attentive without being intrusive. The food is spot on and wonderful. The ambience makes you feel like you are in an episode of The Sopranos or in The Godfather.

name: KevinM
review_content: I'm not a huge fan of the Little Italy scene. It feels too fake and touristy for me but if you're going to eat there this is a good spot to choose. Everything about the restaurant was enjoyable and well done.

name: RichF
review_content: Good ambiance and traditional Italian. Sat in atrium with skylights. Good dining experience

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: This was a wonderful experience! Great and fun service beautiful building and tasty food. Would definitely go again!

name: SANDYJ
review_content: We came here for dinner after my daughter arrived in NYC after a 20 hour flight. This restaurant was recommended to us by a New Yorker and it didn't disappoint.  The food was fantastic!  The servings were very generous the wine selection good and the service outstanding.  If only we had had more time so we could have revisited during our stay.  Next time I'm in NYC this is definitely on the list of 'must do'.

name: Linmal
review_content: My husband I went here for our anniversary. It was a wonderful experience compared to others we have had in Little Italy. Great food and service!

name: Judes
review_content: Great Italian restaurant with quaint outside dining.  They specially made some pasta for my daughter  upon request. Bueno!!!

name: AnnetteB
review_content: Great dinner sitting  outside  beautiful courtyard but there was a prom event in it .  We loved the risotto and fresh pasta ...also the zucchini strip appetizers were amazing .   Fun and friendly staff

name: Laura
review_content: We look forward to being able to sit outside and watch the world go by on Mulberry Street while indulging in a long-craved for dinner!

name: CatherineF
review_content: You'll need to ask them how they can modify certain menu items to make them vegetarian. They're very happy to do so. The vegetarian puttanesca is fantastic! The burrata appetizer is also lovely.

name: RRRDFW
review_content: Little Italy landmark great food servers that know Italian food. Great wine list that won't break the bank servers are knowledgeable about what Italian wines pair best with entrees ordered. Note the Sopranos mentions throughout the restaurant.

name: BeMyValentine
review_content: Great food with great friends and family in the skylight room at the James Gandolfini alcove. A perfect way to cap off a fun day in Little Italy.

name: Gprim
review_content: Excellent as always

name: bnp4food
review_content: The best restaurant on Mulberry St.!  Owner Sal Esposito is a gracious host and brings an outstanding total experience to Little Italy. Food is outstanding and our waiter Angelo was an incredible partner throughout the evening. Il Cortile is the only restaurant to visit when in Little Italy.

name: Mark
review_content: Enjoyed the restaurant. Great food would definitely go back!!!

name: AnneF
review_content: I came to NY with family as a Christmas gift to them. We originally had ten in our party which reduced to eight. We were brought to a room with a round table and squarePushed together. When I told the maitre de Our numbers had changed he immediately brought us to a beautiful area near the garden room. The table was perfect! Atmosphere was friendly and inviting!Food was fabulous and our waiter and assistants were spectacular!I had been before with my gal pals and experience was sUperb . Thank you for aLovely time.Anne Ferrari Greenberg

name: dmisita
review_content: Returning to this restaurant for our 10 year anniversary was romantic. We had our first date here. The food unfortunately wasn't as good as we remembered.  My wife's seafood didn't taste fresh. My food was acceptable but not great.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We walked in for a 7 PM reservation on a Sunday evening and should have turned around and walked out on seeing that the place was practically empty.  This once-great place now has below-average food and probably will not be open much longer.   After dinner we strolled the area (Little Italy) and noted that other restaurants seemed to have their usual crowd.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: My husband and I went for our anniversary and we had a wonderful meal. Staff very very attentive ! Drinks were also great! We will go back next time for sure

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Had a wonderful meal at Il Cortile the other night.  The branzino was great the ambience lovely the service very attentive.  Would definitely return.

name: Mike63
review_content: Went to Il Corteiile with my wife and a couple of friends. We had been there before and always had a good meal. The food this time was very good but it didn't contain all of what was listed on the menu. The server tried to rectify it and gave us some desserts to compensate us. All in all we had a very good time.

name: RoseEspo
review_content: Sadly the Italian section is shrinking in NYC's "Little Italy".........The one thing you can be sure of is the fact that Il Cortile is still one of the best restaurants on Mulberry Street & you can always get a wonderful meal.  I cannot wait to go back !

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: With all the competition around they need to up their game. Nothing to set it aside. Stale bread (not Italian). No amuse bouche. No amaretto wth coffee. No simple Italian side salad. Very nice setting. Competent food. We we there a few years ago and were disappointed to find that it ha not moved on.

name: Ramurphyjr
review_content: This wasn't our first visit to Il Cortile.  We enjoyed the atmosphere and food more than ever.  The veal Melanzane was delicious.

name: New2area
review_content: We were a family group of 5 and had a wonderful time .  The food and service were outstanding and we will certainly go back the next time we're in Little Italy.  A winner!

name: Mom2four
review_content: Fun location in Little Italy. Service was excellent with our waiter giving us a true family Italian restaurant experience. Our meals were excellent. The only thing I'd skip was the calamari which was very bland. Otherwise a great place to go to get a feel for this part of NYC.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Our waiter was amazing food and wine was unforgettable and I will be going there again!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We arrived early and the staff arranged the lounge area so all 8 of us could sit together. All 3 waiters were   extremely friendly fun and attentive. A great time and great  food!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We were passing through NYC and ate here again. The BEST Italian food ever!!! Service was wonderful our waiter was Sal who was hysterical!!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Delicious food.  A large group of students came in after we had ordered and that effected our service.  Although we arrived and were seated before them they were taken care of first.  Our waiter was pleasant and apologetic

name: Lmfood
review_content: My family and I went for easter dinner .  Very good food  a lot of it. A little expensive.For the area where same meal were less.   I would go back and recommend it. As I was told of the place.

name: DonT
review_content: We just had a super wonderful Easter Sundat family dinner for 8 people at Il Cortile and eveyone absolutely loved it - the food the service and the atmosphere. We really appreciated the very friendly fun and helpful way the whole staff treated us....when we are in Little Italy it will always be Il Cortile for us from now on.

name: JeffS
review_content: Good interesting Italian I the heart of little Italy.

name: JaneD
review_content: The restaurant is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. I always visit this restaurant when I am in New York. They have the best Italian food around.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Love coming here to eat whenever we visit NYC. Love this restaurant service is great best food.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: My group from Vancouver Canada had an amazing dinner at Il Cortile! The ambience made us feel like we had been transported to Italy as we were seated in the lovely back skylit area surrounded by brick and greenery. Our food was amazing and the wait staff treated our group of high school girls like they were celebrities! This evening was one of the main highlights of our incredible week in the Big Apple.

name: FrankShirts
review_content: Great for groupsLots to shareGood time

name: deborahlippincott
review_content: Il Cortile is predictably good year after year!  Love dining there when I'm in the city.

name: LU88
review_content: Cannot say enough nice things about Il Cortile.  Everything was absolutely outstanding.  Some of the best Italian food I have ever had and the service is as good as any restaurant in NYC.  The hardest part is actually trying to choose what to eat!  Will absolutely be back

name: MurrowNYC
review_content: This is a must-visit restaurant if you want a classic Little Italy experience. Authentic food of great quality. Good service. Excellent for groups. Fitting for both New Yorkers and tourists. My only complaint is that the wine list is not very robust.

name: AnaA
review_content: The service was great and the food was even better!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Best authentic Italian restaurant. The food is fresh  flavorful and just simply amazing. The service is on point

name: Tomgolfs
review_content: This was my second visit to the restaurant and i enjoyed the food both times. I was with several business associates and we all felt the food was exceptional. The service was very good and we had a lot of attention throughout the meal.My only complaint was that one of my party was drinking ice tea and the refills were an added charge i thought this to be unusual in today's market.

name: ReneeK
review_content: This restaurant was recommended by a local business man in the city.  It was a perfect spot to celebrate a young college student's birthday.  The service was very good and my young adult children loved the vibe and atmosphere of a local Italian place.Will come again!

name: Stepherk
review_content: We had a delicious meal at Il Cortile!  The portions were generous and the meal was great.  The service was fantastic.  The flowers and the center of the restaurant were beautiful.   We enjoyed our meal very much!

name: DMoney
review_content: Asked for a table off to the side for a business group dinner and it was perfect for open discussion. Food and service were good as always. Will return on next trip to Manhattan.

name: Alberto
review_content: Tourist trap! Food was ok. The waiter  added a 20% tip without asking and calculated It over the entire bill including taxes. That was a flagrant abuse. It was charged to my credit card without asking. After complaining the operation was supposedly reversed. I will be checking my credit card Billing account to make sure. Nothing special about this overrated restaurant. This reccomendation should be revised completely. The house wine was very bad.Alberto Miani.

name: stork65
review_content: Nothing exciting or different basic little italy Italian. Excellent staff friendly.

name: Out2sea
review_content: First time visit not disappointed!!  Thanks.

name: Jeff
review_content: Great food beautiful decor no pressure to try an unpriced special or pushed into any entree.  Lots of parties were going on so service was pretty bad but we were not in a rush.  Should have been offered a free glass of wine or a dessert given that it took far too long to get our main courses (over an hour between apps and dinner).  But hey its New York--deal with it.

name: Caesarsally
review_content: We enjoyed our visit to Il Cortile very much. The service was impeccable. Our appetizers were  good fried calamari was tender baked clams were small but tasty. Mussels Fra Diablo were delicious but unfortunately were mostly shells. We did enjoy the sauce. Chicken Scarpariello was plentiful. Could have been seasoned a bit more but enjoyable. Linguini Pescatore was nicely prepared. The dining room is quite beautiful and service is friendly attentive & eager to please.

name: Luis
review_content: The food except for one dish (which was served with under-cooked pasta) was outstanding. The service was pleasant but spotty. Entrees did not all arrive at the same time (last plate served 15 minutes after the first!). Server apologized but the same happened with desserts. I was done with my coffee by the time my dessert arrived. Again great food (despite the one-dish mishap) but not sure worth trying again. Several other near-by restaurants have it all figured out. Very big shame because we did love the food! Management overall is poor.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Everything was really good. I would need to go back to give a better opinion as I've only been there once.

name: KellyD
review_content: Turned out to be a fabulous find. Lots of Christmas cheer and despite being packed to the rafters the service was swift and the food was very authentic and delicious.

name: Traci
review_content: We had a horrible experience at this restaurant .  we made a reservation for 7 PM we got there at 6:50 PM the Italian  ma√Ætre d' must've told us 10 times that he was working on a table we stood there for a half an hour while other people walked in and got seated right away without reservations .   We finally got our table we ordered our pasta dishes and our dishes came looking like a kids size meal we cannot even believe they charge $20 for half a serving of pasta .  The whole experience was horrible we will never go there again.   Back to Angelo's on Mulberry Street!!

name: MaryE57
review_content: A family favorite of ours.  Always a great experience.  The service food & wine are terrific!

name: AngelR
review_content: I've been to several restaurants in Little Italy - and this has to be one of the best.  Food was delicious - service was great. Extensive wine list. We arrived 45 minutes early with a large party and were very nicely seated early.

name: Sorento
review_content: We eat here every time we come to NY. It is always very good. The meatball appetizer is a great way to start your meal.

name: Phil
review_content: Found this place on Open Table based on reviews. Excellent food very attentive service. Relaxed and friendly. Ask for the lunch menu for best prices.

name: 1Eagle
review_content: We have gone to IL Cortile almost every time we have visited NYC for over 20 years and love this place. Our family group of 9 dined there a couple of evenings ago to a person every one thought  the entire experience was perfect. Our last dinner there was in September of this year during the Feast and they as well as the other restaurants in Little Italy are set up on the street. That is always a fun experience also.

name: Dependable66
review_content: A traditionalgotoprestaurant but The food is not as good as it used to be  unless it wasn't as good as I remember.  They should go up to Boston north end and learn as much as they can.  The patio smelled like an ash tray  we'll not be back.

name: otsarabeth
review_content: Branzino special was amazing caprese salad was freshest I have ever tasted. Wine suggestion was spot on. Patient and knowledgeable staff that was also very friendly!

name: StefTravelor
review_content: Food was good but not excellent.  There are so many other Italian restaurants that are much better.

name: Shanda
review_content: I have eaten at this establishment everytime I have visited NYC and it gets better each year! At home I eat at Carrabbas for Italian cuisine and I think it is wonderful but this restaurant is so much better. I try to order something new each time so I can try it all eventually! This time I had the gnocchi filled with chicken and spinach and topped with a mascarpone sauce. It was divine. The staff is always friendly and we love the waiter Salvatore!

name: MB0461
review_content: Never been to this place before. Liked the reviews I saw on open table so decided to try it out. Took my mom & daughter here. The first thing that caught our attention was the ambiance. it was very nice & noise level was very low another plus. The wait staff was very attentive & pleasant.. Given that it wasn't full at the time we got there but still. Our appetizer & meals were delicious. Everything cooked well  no complaints whatsoever. We actually found this place to be a place to come back to either with small or large group.  Just want to say Thank you to them for a very nice time we had there.

name: Winendine
review_content: We loved our meal!   The stuffed meatball appetizer - was just outstanding.  We are all still dreaming about it. We shared the main courses so we could enjoy more - that was perfect. Thank you for a lovely dinner.

name: Tiffany
review_content: great food the pork chop was delish! great environment and service.

name: Mickeywomwoms
review_content: Went here with my dad who was in town visiting and wanted to go to little Italy. Overall out experience was great! The atmosphere was nice (we sat in the back "garden" area and it was very pretty). We went on a Tuesday night so it was also very quiet. The food was very good too! It was nice to find a place that sells good burrata as that is one of our favorite things. The menu was a bit pricier than other restaurants in the area but the food was also better quality and the service was wonderful. Overall we loved it.

name: RVatl
review_content: For over 20 years this has been my go to restaurant when visiting NYC.  My favorite appetizer is the Schiacciata di Salsicce e Carciofi (sausage artichoke and mozzarella pie).  It is a very unique dish and quite delicious!Service always feels like you are visiting with your Italian uncle....so warm and friendly!

name: PaulaG
review_content: Excellent meal as always.   Highly recommend.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We picked this off trip advisor so it was a lucky choice this is a super restaurant we had a party of 10 and they rally looked after us. The house wine was super too.

name: TimoReview555
review_content: I love this place...food never disappoints and consistent.I feel like all the servers are from Sicily...Very attentive and care about service...Food is excellent!Great date spot!

name: Peacock
review_content: Good service but overpriced specials and average food yield a very ordinary dining experience. The restaurant was understandably busy but extremely noisy on a Friday evening.Il Palazzo which unfortunately closed was a much better high end dining experience in Little Italy.Pass.

name: IlCo
review_content: I have been going to Il Cortile for years. It is always great! The service is amazing!! My only  complaint is they cut back on the bread basket! Highly recommended!!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I hadn't been to il Cortile in a LONG time and I am very happy that it's still really a great place. We had a lovely birthday dinner. Best food in Little Italy. Keep it up!

name: Leanna
review_content: Me and my boyfriend come here on the anniversary of our first date which was here. We love the food and are always treated like family. Would definitely reccomend.

name: Tara
review_content: We go to Il Cortile several times a year and like it very much. The restaurant has a cute Italian atmosphere particularly in the "courtyard" room.  The menu is large and diverse and the quality of the food is very good. It would be nice to see a return of the mix-and-match pasta and sauce selections.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: we have been to them all and this is by far the best.  Classic dishes prepared with care and fresh ingredients.

name: Zee1
review_content: We were a group of 20 people celebrating my daughter's 30th birthday.  Overall our experience at Il Cortile was good but not excellent.  Upon arrival we were made to wait about 30 minutes prior to being seated although the 7:45pm reservation had been made way in advance. Most of the food was very good but there were a couple of pasta dishes that were sub-par...the pasta was extremely under cooked rather than  al dente.  The pasta was crunchy and difficult to chew.  Our group also ordered a cake which was overpriced and somewhat dry not moist at all.While the wait staff was courteous they seemed to be understaffed and at times the wait to request additional water or drinks was exceptionally long.  Trying to get our check at the end of the evening also took an exceptionally long time.  Although we were seated a bit later than our reservation the staff seemed anxious for our group to leave the restaurant by 10:00pm.  We closed our bill and left at approximately 10:20pm.

name: SarahT
review_content: Smallish menu food tasted fine but expensive for what it was. The shock came when I was charged $10 for a small glass of luke warm Pinot Grigio. There's no drinks menu given so the cost was a surprise. I wouldn't return.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Only negative comment is that we were not informed they were serving an limited menus during the weekday. Had been looking forward to have a regular menus dish but had to settle for an for something from the limited menu

name: RRRRR
review_content: Great food and wine. The garden dining room is so nice.  Gladly recommend for lunch and dinner.

name: Pepper
review_content: If you are entertaining visitors from out of town and want to experience Little Italy this is a nice place.Right in Mulberry Street you can sit outside and watch the action go in the restaurant or eat in the enclosed courtyard garden.Food is just average but you are indeed in the center of Little Italy which is great for tourists.Better Italian food  is elsewhere.Service was ok ambiance very nice.

name: Steveo
review_content: Went with a family visiting NY.  Hood food service was great.  Found this on a list of outdoor dining.  The garden room was nice but wasn't outdoors.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I really wanted to like Il Cortile. It's in an iconic albeit increasingly touristy neighborhood in Manhattan but at the end of the meal it just didn't get me there. The decor really has not held up over time and it's left the place feeling chintzy. The food was really just okay and made me think that O could have made those meals just as well at home. I go to a restaurant like that to get a unique warmth of preparation that just wasn't there. The service was quite excellent and attentive though it may have been due to the fact that we were the only ones there.As much as it pains me to say it if you want that family feel in dining go to Carmines. If you want to be dazzled and enriched by delicate Italian cooking go to Gennaro. If you must get the authentic Little Italy experience Il Piccolo Bufalo is probably your best bet. Because unfortunately Il Cortile just doesn't have it anymore

name: Spike
review_content: A friend recommended the restaurant.  The food was not extraordinary by any means.  The red wine by the glass was poor.  Bread was served with packaged butter like Denny's.

name: NJOREats
review_content: Weak sauces 'aged seafood' overdone pasta heavily accented waiters speaking far to fast to understand ( by the way their native language wasn't Italian) . . . . I could go on but why.  This was last little Italy restaurant worth going to.  Now it isn't either.  Head to the Bronx or anywhere else in SoHo or Greenwich.  There are just too many better places to go that will be much better in both food and value.  Let the tourists waist their money but they should be warned too.  Just eat Chinese when you're in that part of the NYC.

name: Blondie
review_content: This restaurant was very good with great food and friendly staff.  There were 4 of us and I booked a table in the "garden" room which is lovely.  Had a bottle of Chianti great wine but would like to have seen a more extensive wine list at more reasonable prices other than that it was a great experience overall. I would definitely eat there again.

name: Twofrom802
review_content: My wife and I went there last year on our trip to New York and kind of stumbled upon the il cortile while walking around little Italy. When we planed our trip this year the first thing we both agreed on was dinner at that Italian restaurant we went to last year. It took no time at all to find it online I just googled best places toeat in little Italy

name: Udonsan
review_content: Sign in the front said pasta lunch $12. I received the  bill that same pasta $22 and automatically 20% gratuities charged. I claimed the restaurnat owner he said I didn't mention "Lunch Special". My $22 vongole clams white sauce spagetti. Clams are too chewy and I don'think they are from fresh clams. If they were the chef totally ruined them.  My $10 glass of chardonnay was bad and it came in a little cheep glass... If you want to eat Italian don't go to Little Italy. Go to Locanda Verde Quolity Italian or Marea. You can get exellent pasta with the same cost.

name: MaryKay
review_content: This is my favorite restaurant in Little Italy.  The Sunday sauce is a must have!

name: TimothyD
review_content: This was a terrific meal for 3 generations of Italian Americans.  In the middle of touristy not-so-enticing places it was a gem. Tastes around the table ranged from nice salads to a thick veal chop to pasta with asparagus and chicken.  All very well received  topped off by excellent service.

name: Brandie
review_content: We were early for our reservation and were still seated immediately.  The staff was so nice and attended to our every need.  A special custom dish was prepared for my daughter in a smaller portion.  The food was delicious!  Loved the ambiance of eating in the sunroom like garden room.  Beautiful!  If we're ever in NYC again we"ll go back!

name: sportydog
review_content: I've been here several times-always excellent service and food.  Brought out-of-town friends who loved everything about the restaurant.  Portions good and reasonably priced.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: My husband & I joined another couple on Saturday night for dinner at Il Cortile.  I made ressies well in advance through Open Table yet when we arrived they couldn't find our reservation on the list...finally after telling me we didn't have reservations the young man at the door asked if I booked though Open Table. I said yes and after checking on line found our reservations.  We were seated immediately at a table right near the front door (it was 20f that evening) and in front of the closet where they keep the red wine.  Our friend had to put her coat back on because she was so cold and my chair was bumped no less than 30 times during the meal as wait staff attempted to get into the wine closet.  What fun. The service was lacking from the word go...no wine list after a 15 minute wait a waiter appeared slowly followed by a wine list.  We ordered wine and dinner had to chase a manager to get a second bottle of wine to rectify a wrong starter and more.  Our waiter was MIA for the majority of our stay.  The husbands enjoyed their meals far more than the wives did! I went "safe" and ordered chicken parm and the red sauce was cloying and unappealing.  I ate only a few bites of my meal and the only question that was directed at me and my plate was do you want that wrapped? No concern that I didn't enjoy my meal at all.  That being said the entire experience from our welcome to leaving spoke volumes that the management team didn't care if I enjoyed my visit.  If they can rest on their laurels and regulars? Good luck to them. I will not be one of them nor will our friends/family.

name: Japonte90
review_content: The staff was friendly the food was delicious. The ambiance was good the decor was nice. Visited for the first time on vday definitely a good choice. Will visit again soon.

name: Enrique
review_content: Fantastic food great wine and a respected service team that makes you feel comfortably laid back and relaxed.  Highly recommended for family couples & groups!

name: AXADining
review_content: This is by far the best place to dine in Little Italy. A trip to NYC must include an evening at Il Cortile. We starting dining here in the late 90's and have never been disappointed in either the food or the service. this is "real" Italian food do not let anyone tell you otherwise.

name: Elaina
review_content: Great food and service.  Will dine again.  Fried mozzarella was delicious as an appetizer.

name: brooklynsam
review_content: Waiter forgot our appetizer and just brought out the entrees after about 15 minute but that was ok. He seemed sorry and we would have been full anyway. Overall service was fine. Food was very good. Ambiance was nice - way more spacious than I expected for Little Italy. I'd go back!

name: Lesli
review_content: Well it's a very beautiful place. The Gardend is super romantic. Food is okay. Could be better. And too quite. Like uncomfortable quite

name: outoftowner2
review_content: Most Little Italy places get sold short especially in your basic travel guides So at the risk of being labeled as some one who only eats at "red sauce joints" I'l Cortile is an excellent choice for a Little Italy dinner . The menu is presented as a closed letter  which makes for a unique clean way to start the meal. A number of places opened 30 - 40 years sometimes present menu's that look like they were made from the first day they were opened. I ordered the fettuccine di parma- homemade noodles with sweet sausage which was excellent.The rest of my party experienced their Pollo line - Chicken Marsala Francese and Parmigiana . They were enjoyed be all. portions were plentiful. Service was professional.  With so many places to choose in this area you can't go wrong with I'l Cortile. Be sure to stop in the Church a few doors down it's worth the visit.

name: mamazen
review_content: We had a table of 14.  The service was wonderful the food excellent.   We had a great experience.

name: Maureen
review_content: Love eating here when in Little Italy. Great place to go because the food and service is outstanding. I had the sole (fish of the day) and it was cooked perfectly. The decor is very rustic with the brick walls and large doors. Food we had all came out hot and was delicious eggplant  calamari mozzerella and caponata were our apps. Two people had the Sunday sauce ( only avail on sat & sun). Will be going back here next time in the area!!

name: Teamhogan
review_content: Always great never disappointing! A must when visiting Little Italy. !

name: Yudhi
review_content: We were travelling from Australia and wanted to find a resturant that were able to cater for 11 guests located in little Italy.  Used opentable and this resturant came up as an option.It was easy to book and cater for 11.Large open areas to allow eating for large groups.  We were catching up with some of my family that lives in NYC.  There were 5 adults and 6 kids ( age ranging from 5 - 13 years old).Typical italian food and it was all delicious.

name: Peruna66
review_content: Every time we visit New York we make a point to have one meal at Il Cortile Restaurant.  This trip we made TWO visits!!  Each time the food the wine and the service was simply outstanding.  The stuffed shrimp with spinach was delicious as was the veal marsala.  Il Cortile is the true gem of Little Italy especially with its covered courtyard...a nice place for a romantic dinner.  However it IS a popular spot so be sure and make reservations for dinner.  Two thumbs up!!

name: JGfromNJ
review_content: Pasta is fresh service is very good.  Had to send clams oreganata back fishy.  First time I ever sent something back to the kitchen at Il Cortile.  Will return though it's my favorite spot in Little Italy.  Ask for seating in atrium.

name: Strattonknows
review_content: Some of the restaurants in Little Italy have forgotten that it is food not personality thatkeeps people coming back. The sauces are fresh the cheeses are phenomenal and the seafood can't be beat. So its your traditional southern italian menu done exactly the way mom would have made it. You are made to feel special as waiters talk to you from across a crowded room. Salvatore our waiter was particularly good at creating a warmth that makes everything taste better and the wine recommendations were spot on--and argued about between wait staff and maitre'd  Go now.

name: DougC
review_content: Each member of my family had a different meal -- all four (because I sampled each of them personally) were superb!!  I'd return anytime I visit NY.

name: RitaK
review_content: We dined here on Christmas Eve. They accommodated our party of 13 and upon our arrival the table was ready. They even called to confirm so we were comfortable that all would be well. It is difficult to obtain a table for 13. The food was very good the service was excellent and the wine reasonably priced. It is also children friendly.

name: MDante
review_content: I knew Little Italy was a tourist trap but a friend was in from Seattle and I read a review in the NY Times that said this place was good.  Absolute chaos.  We had a reservation but it mattered little and were forced to wait 20 minutes or more past our time.  Eventually they sit us near the door where it is opened constantly and was freezing outside.  Took forever to get each item and get our check.  They forgot to give us the appetizer entirely.  The food was average and the waiter was borderline rude.  I would never go back.  On top of it all it's not cheap and it should be!

name: LBHouston
review_content: The service and food are always wonderful...and the holiday lights are beautiful. The staff have evidently worked there for years and the atmosphere is fun and happy. Definitely would recommend for anyone traveling to NY! The best in Little Italy!

name: Chinahand
review_content: Fettuccine turned out to be spaghetti. I thought this was supposed to be a genuine Italian restaurant.

name: toma
review_content: Impressed the first time less impressed the second. Monkfish with artichokes had the tough leaves in the dish. $12 for a standard cocktail? Even for NYC that was too expensive.

name: DineOutOften
review_content: Enjoyed lunch on a Saturday with my wife and a friend. It was our first time so we didn't know what to expect but went based on reviews. Turned out to be a solid pick. The d√©cor is old school Italian perhaps a bit outdated. My guests enjoyed a couple of different pastas with bolognese sauce and reported it to be very good. I had the veal scaloppini piccata and it was excellent. Service was a little slow but our server was overall competent and pleasant. The lunch menu appears to be the same that they use for dinner so it was a little pricey for a lunch spot in Little Italy. Overall a good experience. I would return.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Our family has been going to IL Cortile for years. The food ambiance and service are impeccable.

name: yanksansky
review_content: The place is exactly as I remember it. The manager took us to the back of the restaurant to relax after a long day of walking through the 9/11 Museum. They had the nicest bartender serve up drinks in a cozy private area where we could talk quietly about our day. Then we were off to our table in the main dining area...warm breads were served with olive oil and butter. We had a wonderful server Fabrizio.  Singing at tables is customary as we viewed an extensive menu. I ordered a simple dish of linguine and white clam sauce others ordered the bolognese and pasta fagiole soups with broccoli rabe  all were excellent. great day and experience

name: ilovefoodalot
review_content: Great service! The Italian food was very good but nothing that you couldn't find at an Italian restaurant anywhere in the country

name: JASM
review_content: Very inviting! Very authentic Italian cuisine and staff! We really enjoyed the seafood pasta! Highly recommend it!

name: Iowan
review_content: Excellent restaurant in the heart of little italy. Impeccable service great atmosphere and professionalism abound. The food was above reproach and very reasonably priced. We will most definitely be back!

name: SarahF
review_content: Dined here for my husband's birthday while in NYC for the weekend.  The long cab ride from Times Square to Little Italy (in trafffic) was worth the wait!  Would come here again every trip to NY!  Kids were wih us and they loved it too.   Specials were unique and delicious.  My daughter had lobster ravioli my son fettucini alfredo with shrimp.  I had the traditional chicken parm and my husband a unique seafood special.  All amazing.  In fact everything (bread wine appetizers dinner) was delicious. You can tell this is a neighborhood restaurant and quite popular as many people knew each other which made it even more fun.  We enjoyed being part of the ambiance for the evening.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I'm so happy to have eaten in Il Cortile it's always a special great.  The food is wonderful- great quality.  If want better than average Italian food this is the restaurant o go to.   Service is excellent too.

name: kjb27flw
review_content: Great atmosphere and attentive staff but bad food is bad food.  My "stuffed" shrimp was not stuffed but sitting among a pile of mushrooms peppers and gorgonzola cheese - totally overcooked.  The meat ravioli totally unforgettable.  The calamari flavorless - but the marinara sauce was great.  When I left most of my shrimp dish untouched and the server asked how it was - I told him.  The manager brought over a complimentary dessert.  It was a white cake with fruit in it - melon.   It was not good - the bottom layer totally dry (and it didn't taste good).  We were looking for an authentic Italian meal and boy were we disappointed.

name: NYCJean
review_content: This restaurant is our go to place when we have visitors to NY.  We have noticed that the portion sizes have increased over the years and the ambiance is not as good as it used to be.  There was a  party in the next room which was very loud and their microphones kept ringing from feedback issues.  It was annoying and hard to have a good conversation.  The waiter suggested a very good house wine which we enjoyed but the service otherwise was nothing special.

name: JMKM
review_content: Service was great very attentive. Bolognese was best I've had in years.

name: sportydog
review_content: Consistently good food.  I have eaten here several times.  Large dinner portions at a reasonable price.  I had the monkfish but had the white sauce changed to a red sauce it was delicious.

name: julianaoliveira
review_content: Good italian food not many options of wine by the glass.

name: KarenBBB
review_content: Italian waiters lend an authentic feel to this Mulberry Street gem. Love the Chicken Francese the seafood pasta  salads are huge and wonderful. Many happy memories!

name: ChristineLong
review_content: What a find!  Thank you opentable.com for having wonderful dining options.  I have not been disappointed yet and Il Cortile topped the dining list on this 4 day vacation to The City.  It felt as though we were enjoying dinner at home with their family of servers and chefs.  Spot on perfect sauce great service!

name: tad1232000
review_content: You really pay for the location not worth it. Overpriced and not very good food or wine. Def not go back.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Food is good but took an hour for our dinner to be served -- not worth that! And waiter didn't come back to check on our table once!Busboys took care of us.

name: LouSev
review_content: This is one of my favorite places to go the first time I went there was 1979!  The food is amazing and the service is the best I have ever had go there you will not be disappointed!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: not very crowded yet given table for two by the kitchen...hence ambiance gets a knockFrom NY so I can deal with a impersonal waiter but did find it odd that as he was delivering the table next to us their main courses as he was passing another table he stopped and showed them each dish....."and this is the rigatoni " ...shoes it to the table next to meet first then went over to the table it was intended for...did it with 3 dishes..Had the veal Parmesan...very average.. Rigatoni with mushroom..my teen daughter who is not to very picky has two bites and was unimpressed..

name: donnybaseball
review_content: My wife and I ate here as this restaurant was highly recommended.  The food was fantastic I would not hesitate to return to this restaurant.  If you like great food you will not be disappointed....

name: Foodie123
review_content: Our server Frank made the experience a great one!  He was attentive and witty and made great suggestions.  A very impressive menu and the food was fantastic!

name: Ronnie
review_content: We were meeting friends from England who were visiting NYC on holiday.  We chose Il Cortile for dinner because of the great location it's ambiance and having experienced their delicious food in the past.  Once again we were not disappointed and the diverse menu was thoroughly enjoyed by our out of town guests.

name: Melg
review_content: Really enjoyed our time here food was lovely n thoroughly enjoyed it x

name: LVan
review_content: The menu was so extensive it took us awhile to decide.  They also had great gluten free choices.  Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. Service was knowledgeable and attentive.

name: ItalysFinest
review_content: We had a group of four people dining on a Saturday evening. It wasnt packed at all in fact there were only maybe another four tables of people. Very quiet. We were seated right away but after that the service took a long time. The food was okay. The people I went with said it was okay and finished their plates however i could only eat a quarter of my chicken dish because it tasted like pure salt.

name: 1Eagle
review_content: Regardless of where else we dine while in the city Il Cortile is a must do stop. The food quality selection and service are always top notch. Add to that the Little Italy location and Il Cortile makes for a perfect evening.

name: Diana
review_content: The seafood pasta was loaded with perfectly cooked seafood!

name: Susan
review_content: There are many restaurants up and down Mulberry Street but they are not all created equal.  Resist the urge to wander into the first restaurant that looks good and steer yourself to Il Cortile where the food is out of this world. There is a lovely dining patio out front but if you wish a quieter setting ask to be seated in the garden atrium.  Full of character and quiet.  Service is outstanding....ice water and a big bread basket appear instantly and the menu is printed on a gold-sealed folded paper.  We were a party of four and each dish was excellent.  The veal dishes were creatively prepared and were the best we had ever eaten.  Interesting wine selection and an array of yummy deserts.  This is the place to eat if you love good food.

name: vpmad1
review_content: Il Cortile came highly recommended to me from several sources.  Although I don't live IN NYC I live nearby. When cousins came visiting from California I volunteered to be their guide in the city and I wanted to treat them to a nice dinner in Little Italy.  Il Cortile did NOT disappoint.  We were greeted warmly and given a lovely table underneath a skylight.  The menu is extensive filled with wonderful Italian fare all of it deliciously fresh.  Our server Frank was just the right balance of speed courtesy and helpfulness.  The rest of the waitstaff was also courteous and efficient.  The food was delicious and although the desserts looked wonderful I only had room to finish off with a nice cappuccino. We will return.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We found this place using Open Table and had plans to go to another restaurant in the same vicinity.  After reading the reviews for this place we decided to give it a try just in case we needed reservations. We had an absolute perfect time. The food service and ambiance were great.  Would go back.

name: JAYinNYC
review_content: Sitting outside on a cool summer night was a great experience. Service was fantastic and the waiters were very attentive and jovial. Good food but perhaps a bit overpriced for the area.

name: zazie86
review_content: Cousins asked to lunch at an Italian restaurant in Little Italy. I remembered a sun-filled atrium greenery marble statues bricks and bright color and chose Il Cortile on Mulberry Street..  The cousins arrived late but the waitstaff was very cordial while we waited.  To keep cool we ate inside with an outside view and ordered iced tea.  The bread refills were free not so the tea.  I erred with the gamberi fantasia (jumbo shrimp stuffed and wrapped).  My husband said the shrimp scampi was only okay however the cousins enjoyed several of the appetizers as lunch. Italian is not my favorite cuisine and to me the food did not measure up to the d√©cor and service however my cousins had a wonderful time and that‚Äôs what counts.

name: Amanda
review_content: I didn't think the Italian food was that good at all. Everything was a little bland for me. I eat a lot of Italian food and this is not a place I would go back to. This whole street was a little too touristy. Go a street or two over and the food is much better. The people around us seemed to enjoy their food at this restaurant  so maybe everything I chose was just not the restaurants best dish. Not sure  but I wouldn't ever go back.

name: pfg33
review_content: Went with my girlfriend this Sunday night.  There is a glass-roof atrium inside that gives the room an outdoor feel.  Sal our waiter was very friendly and attentive.  We planned on splitting our entrees (mushroom risotto and filet mignon) so Sal put both items on our respective plates which was a nice touch.  Recommended and would definitely dine here again!

name: Angry
review_content: The service was outstanding.  The food had an amazing taste from the first bite! I highly recommend.

name: DJFDMD
review_content: We had a reservation for dinner @ 7:45 on a Thursday evening for a party of four adults.  Service was so slow.  Our meals did not come to the table for 45 minutes.  We ordered pasta dishes which were very good.  Noise level is very high and ambience was a zero.

name: Lucky
review_content: Fabulous food and atmosphere! We celebrated my sisters birthday dinner here. Would definitely recommend this place for its delicious food and ambiance! Service was also fantastic.

name: HappyDiner
review_content: It was nice to be able to find a restaurant in Little Italy that offered gluten free pasta penne or spaghetti. My entree was delicious and the place was very nice.

name: TheresaC
review_content: We had never been here sitting outside and enjoying the culture of Little Italy with the delicious food was great.  My husband stated that the chicken marsala was the "best he ever had" my daughter loved everything about it as well as myself down to the delicious cappucino.

name: MelissaS
review_content: I had an open table reservation and was still seated a half hour later. We were sat down and didn't see our server for drinks for another 20 minutes.
