The food was very good once we got it but it did come out at separate times not all at once for our dinners. So one person in our party didn't have food while we all waited. It was very authentic italian food that was delicious but I wouldn't go back because of the service/experience.

name: SuzyQ
review_content: Il Cortile is an authentic Italian restaurant.  The waiters are from Italy and often speak Italian to enhance the feel of being in Italy. The food is outstanding and nothing is overpriced. Well worth the visit if you're ever in Manhattan's Little Italy.

name: Atlantan
review_content: Even though in the midst of touristy Little Italy Il Cortile continues to deliver a high level of Italian food and ambience. For us it's the Italian food fix we have to have when visiting NYC. The very serene Garden Room sets the tone. And the classic food delivers a memorable evening.A hint: be sure to try the sausage/artichoke pie appetizer.

name: Mcstangle
review_content: Everyone was thrilled with their food best marinara sauce I have ever had. Great service and it has a cute courtyard area in the back.

name: Netchar
review_content: Had lunch here with five friends. Found it on Trip Advisor. Food was excellent and the service 5 star. Wine was delicious and the location right in the middle of Little Italy

name: Jeffrey
review_content: For a bustling Saturday evening in early August on Mulberry Street Il Cortile was quieter than most of the other places along the strip. Our olive oil was old with a bitter taste. The waiter happily gave us a fresher replacement but in very little quantity. The manager thought it necessary to come over to our table and admonish us for this ask and I put in gently yet firmly in his place. He picked a fight with me which was so unnecessary and unprofessional. The food was wine but not special and there were 9 of us who felt the same way. Mediocre wine was overpriced. We will never be back.

name: Danylo
review_content: Food value was great. Quality was very good and so was the service. Definitely sit outdoors as there is much to experience.

name: QuiteaGlitzyShow
review_content: Really great Italian Food served hot and full of flavor. A great value too. Great mature Italian wine for $60 instead of $120-$150 in other restaurants. The waiters are hilarious. They joke with you. Argue with one another a little bit over how much they had to help. All  part of being Authentic. The sidewalk tables overlooking the sideshow of Mulberry street) are the best place to sit on a nice summer evening. But our group was too big so we had to go inside where maybe the lights are a little too bright and the ambience not so rustic . Still a great relaxing place to eat though. Unlike Midtown restaurants where space is calculated with a ruler and eating time with a stop watch. You have plenty of space and never feel rushed here.

name: Imnotyourmomma
review_content: It's always a "Must do" when I visit NY and have been going there for over 40 years. Celebrated my B-Day with family and enjoyed the Veal Chop one of their specialties. Everyone ordered something different and my 25-43 "Foodie" kids raved about the meal. Can't wait to go back.

name: TD03054
review_content: The food was outstanding!  Each member in our party of four was very pleased with their entrees.  The filet mignons were cooked perfectly to the request all pasta was fresh sauces delicious and a fabulous risotto.  Calamari appetizer was tender bread basket was yummy.  The Garden Room seating was very pleasant.  Our waiter was abrupt I asked for a wine list and he named 5 wines rather than producing a list.  He never smiled and seemed annoyed that we weren't in a rush. Bus staff was attentive and pleasant however when we declined desserts bus staff immediately whisked every item off our table clearly anxious to reset it for next guests. However the quality food and delightful ambience would bring me back next time I'm in NYC.

name: BobG
review_content: The food was very good and the service was good in most ways. Attractive setting. Can accommodate groups.Have been there several times before although not recently.  Hasn't lost a step.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: My fiance and I decided to take a mini weekend vacation to NYC. We found Il Cortile on Google and decided we would try it. I had the Lobster Ravioli which was sub par. The filling was more of a lobster stuffing with more stuffing than lobster. My fiance got the veal parm. It was incredible. The sauce was tangy and sweet and the veal was tender and salty creating the perfect balance.

name: RayW
review_content: Il Cortile has lost it's luster and charm. I've been frequenting this establishment in Little Italy for 15 years during virtually each time I'm in NYC. While it's courtyard is still pleasant the quality of the food has diminished and it seems salt has replaced authentic ingredients. In addition the wait staff is no longer Italian nor attentive which in my view was a big part of the appeal.

name: JohnK
review_content: Our dining experience was a  huge disappointment. Huge disappointment. First we waited about 1/2 hour for a waiter to come by.One person in our group ordered 2 appetizers as an entree. One of them came out with her salad. She sent it back until the right time. Eventually when we were done with our salads they brought the same dish back out - eggplant rollatini - mushed down and browned on top from being re-heated (poorly). My husband's dinner came out with that - scallops - which he loved. My dinner came out about 25 minutes later when they were done. It was pasta with pesto. I asked for shrimp with it - 5 or 6 overcooked tough shrimp.  The 4th person in our party ate about 30 minutes after I got my dinner.

name: Eileen
review_content: With so any restaurants to choose from in Little Italy  it's basically a crap shoot!  Let me narrow your selection process to one of the best (may be THE best but I do hold back since I haven't tried them all).  First off we were able to park on the street in front of the restaurant.  We were warmly greeted upon our arrival.  The waiter Angelo was extremely experienced attentive and helpful. The food was amazing the service was impeccible and pricing was affordable.  Each of us in our party of four had a main meal and we shared three appertizers.  The cocktails were professionally made and the wine was excellent.  Hands down this is an excellent restaurant in Little Italy!

name: BradS
review_content: The ONLY positive here is the ability to sit outside in Little Italy and do some people watching....food below average....service is horrid...stay away.

name: EduardoC
review_content: Last saturday 5th july I returned to Il Cortile in little Italy NY. I tryed among other plates the most amazing lobster ravioli ever! chef sugestion it was not on the menu. Amazing full of flavour!

name: Bigred3xxx
review_content: Just what one expects when dining out in NYC's little Italy

name: kitkat
review_content: The atmosphere and the food were exceptional for this Italian restaurant.  We shared the fried calamari appetizer which my kids absolutely loved.  My son had the best Filet he has ever tasted.  I enjoyed the Linguini with clams. My daughter asked for a special order which they put together for her.  Definitely recommend.

name: LouAnn
review_content: One of the best Italian meals that I have ever had!  Staff was very attentitive and friendly. I also loved the decor comfortable Italian setting.

name: Timmstir
review_content: Great Italian with attentive staff at a reasonable price.

name: NYCgirls6
review_content: This was our second visit to Il Cortile and it was just as delicious as we remembered it to be. The courtyard dining is great for a group and the waiters are very friendly and helpful. As for the food by fsr the best Italian food I have ever eaten. We were a group of 6 and everyone loved their meal. It is a definite stop on our trip every time!!

name: pmny
review_content: One of the better establishments in Little Italy. Good quality food. Great service! This restaurant is big for Little Italy. It has three dinning areas. The main dinning area with the sky light is the nicest.

name: Lynn
review_content: We tried outdoor dining . I have to admit I am not generally a fan. It was fantastic. Although several tourists took our photos which was kind of strange. The best thing about Il Cortile. Order whatever you like...even if its not on the menu and they will make it for you. Service was outstanding! Food delicious. A perfect lunch.

name: LoriK
review_content: Food was good.  But the atmsophere was great.  Ate outside on a beautiful evening in the heart of Little Italy!

name: djdean
review_content: Great food and service.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We have been going here since the late 1970's......A real drop in service......Food remains good but attitude needs to change......Will need to thinl long and hard about trying it again soon......

name: Float
review_content: This is our third time we have visited this restaurant in Little Italy. The food and the service is great. The wine is very expensive by the glass($10 per glass).

name: DavidOut
review_content:
We returned to Il Cortile a great Italian meal. The Mozzarella Tomatoes and Basile were a great started for everyone. The Fettuccine de Parma was outstanding and we enjoyed a side of hugh meatballs. We all had an outstanding dinner at this great family restaurant in the heart of "Little Italy",5,5,5,5,Dined on May 22 2014
OpenTable Diner,New Mexico,1 review,"My husband and I decided to splurge on dinner one night while in the city and Il Cortile was our pick.  We got a nice bottle of wine appetizer and two large entrees all for less than $200.  The food was amazing and the wait staff was excellent!  We will be going back during our next trip to NYC!

name: Maggie
review_content: Pretty good italian food.  I love the ambience of Little Italy and this was a fun experience for my friends (first time to New York).  Lobster ravioliand penne with bolognese were good.  The wait staff was not very attentive - took our order brought our food promptly and then disappeared.  I think there are other places to find good Italian.

name: RS1999
review_content: Early dinner w 2 kids (10&12).  Found Il Cortile ambience was very friendly decor great and the food fantastic.  Eggplant rollatine dripping w cheese pesto pasta and stuffed gnocchi delicious.  But the trophy was the Sunday sauce- fantastic.  Kids and I had a real blast and would definitely return!

name: Cnote63
review_content: My wife and I enjoy Il cortile for the authentic Italian food outstanding service and enjoyable atmosphere. there is ample room to relax waitstaff is very personable and italian is spoken here. Food is consistently very good and the montepulciano wine by the glass is very good as well. Try the limoncello for an after dinner aperitif.

name: Ab1986
review_content: I am allergic to gluten asked specifically for a gluten free plate (they offer gluten free pasta) and was not given it. Later I broke out in a rash.

name: bob1
review_content: Nice menu fine wine list very good late night service. Very good.

name: MJManhattan
review_content: Subpar food and inattentive service.  Nothing charming or authentic here -- just dated and messy.

name: DrayDray
review_content: Took my husband for a birthday celebration. The food was divine and the wait staff couldn't have been nicer.  The menu is so appealing that you want to have a taste of all the dishes.  That's why one needs to keep going back.

name: Elizabeth
review_content: I went for my Birthday dinner with my family..it was OK. Wine list was very limit. Not much more to say.

name: Nochainrestaurantsplease
review_content: Dinner with wife and kids 12 & 9 years old. Food was excellent. Lobster ravioli cheese tortellini with lobster pancetta and peas and veal pram. 9 yr. had spaghetti and butter sauce bit enjoyed the tortellini as well. Had it been wife and I the wine list is limited. We found a nice one for $100.  Worth it.

name: MicheleF
review_content: Picked this restaurant based on reviews and Zagat rating. It was good nothing too spectacular. The rigatoni were cooked perfectly al dente which is the way I like them.  Meatball appetizer (yes one meatball but it was huge!) was good but a little bland.  Service was very good and the house red wine was great.  I really wasn't too impressed with the place - there's so many other places to try for Italian food.

name: Ro2Go
review_content: This has always been our favorite in Little Italy and it did not disappoint.

name: scrod
review_content: disappointed that none of the entrees had side dishes of pasta

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The food is good a little pricey but don't expect five star service with the additional cost. It's an all male wait staff that's a little rough around the edges. It does fit into the ambience of Little Italy.

name: Patty
review_content: We thoroughly enjoyed Il Cortile. We were seated in the outdoor dining space in the back with glass enclosure up above. Also the table we sat at was the table James Gandolfini sat at. The food was very good. Only down part of our dining experience was our waiter. He was completely unsatisfactory. He was unfriendly and totally ignored us after taking our dinner order. He brought our dinner and never returned to our table again! We had to ask a waiter from another station of tables to get our bill for us. Not good. But we would go back and just be sure not to get this same waiter!

name: Osfans
review_content: Great food and unique atmosphere in the heart of NYC's Little Italy.

name: Benny
review_content: Asked on opentable for a quiet table and that's just what I gotfor the special occasion we were there for.

name: LIfoodie
review_content: We were going to an event at Capitale and this restaurant is located a few blocks from there. The service was a little bit slow in the beginning but got better as the meal went on. The food was good but nothing impressive in my opinion. Not sure I'd go back.

name: Schinella
review_content: This Restaraunt was amazing. Great food and staff beautiful Restaraunt . We reserved the garden room which was nice cause it had the sunlight coming in from the glass roof. The filet Mignon with the radicchio outstanding. The ambience was perfect loved this place and will be coming back. Not noisy and for two parents with small children going here alone to have a nice quiet dinner was wonderful . The waiter too very helpful with the menu selections. The tartufo was huge and I split it with my husband.

name: Kathy
review_content: Lovely ambience fresh tasty food. There is an extensive menu. It was very clean and light and airy. Old time middle aged Italian waiters. Has a nice little Italy feel but it's not dark dingy and old like some of the restaurants in the area. It's all new and clean and welcoming. We had a meatball appetizer very good. Pasta with bolognese sauce and fish delicious fresh.

name: Casper
review_content: We took our friend here for her birthday. We were immediately impressed by the enormous middle room with its flowers and skylight. The bread appetizers and wine were delicious. Everyone enjoyed their main course. Great fun

name: Patti
review_content: Excellent food - reasonable prices and great service!

name: DDfromDC
review_content: Much larger than I expected for a Manhattan Little Italy restaurant and with incredible food! Super authentic Italian. Everyone in our group of 5 absolutely loved the evening. The wait staff was attentive without being in the way. We would go back in a heartbeat.

name: GibsonS
review_content: Not all that it could have been.We were seated quickly but were given a table better suited for 7-8 than our party of 5. Once the waiter realized three of our party were kids aged 18 15 and 10 he pretty much disappeared. The entrees were quite good but unfortunately I actually had to hunt the waiter down to pay the bill. Lots of promise but make sure your waiters hustle for your dinner customers.

name: SW04
review_content: Fun setting serves up large dishes of classic Italian food. Classic should in no way be interpreted as boring -- food was very good.

name: Janice
review_content: amazing building and decor clean wonderful service not over served.the paper fold out menu was a little awkward because it was large like a newspaper. But a nice concept and had a golden seal prior to opening it.

name: Sanojmon
review_content: We wanted some Italian so of course we decided to visit Little Italy in NYC.1) Parking - It's New York. Find it anywhere you can.2) Ambience - Awesome. It wasn't overwhelming and you could have a conversation at a normal tone and not feel out of place. You felt like you had plenty of room. Very nice old school feel as well lot of character to the place.3) Food - Great! Plenty of food for whatever you are looking for. Everyone in our party picked a winner. The wine list wasn't extensive but they had something for everyone. And they were all great choices.4) Service - Perfect. Even had a slight issue with one dish. Total class. They took care of it quickly and dropped another glass of wine to make up for it.You want to go here.

name: KathrynV
review_content: It was not that anything was bad but it could be said it was quite unremarkable sadly I so wanted it to be really good so sad about it what a shame.

name: Israel
review_content: It's not very good - I don't know where the good reviews come from. Food was mediocre and certainly expensive. Had the Caprese salad (mediocre) and a seafood pasta in which every bit of seafood was overcooked.

name: DebD37
review_content: The food was great..service excellent.....great bread basket.....wish they would have offered some CA reds...but the wine we did choice turned out to be suprisingly good....waiter knew his wines so that was very helpful in making our selection... Great place to celebrate a birthday as the waiters come and sing in Italian..overall lovely restaurant without being touristy...other than the fairly large portions...

name: esw6
review_content: this place had amazing serivce giving us (a large group) many options on menu possibilities. The waiter was wonderful at anticipating our needs. The food was out of this world I can still taste the diver scallops I had for dinner and the antipasta app that was ordered for the table.

name: DahliaDoo
review_content: Chef did not want to accommodate special request to change sauce from cognac to Alfredo on lobster ravioli comment - was that is the way it comes. Other than that left full and happy.

name: CLSC
review_content: We dined with 4 couples who had not been out together in quite some time. The maitre d was kind enough to seat us in a corner where we wouldn't be too loud for other diners and we felt like we had the restaurant to ourselves. The menu had something for everyone- and all enjoyed their selections. Great food great prices we would definitely come back again.(PS: The Happy Birthday serenades are kind of hilarious)

name: Bettereverytime
review_content: Can't wait to dine here again. The atrium patio is a perfect place to enjoy a winter day with natural sunlight and the service and food were excellent. We overstayed our lunch as we were having such a great time.

name: wyorker
review_content: There's a reason I've been going there for years. A comfortable pleasant place with outstanding food.Their dessert choices could use some help. But after the entre you may have room enough for only coffee

name: Brindleroomfanboy
review_content: Broght my girlfriend here for her birthday they accommodated to everything I asked for. Owner walked us to our table. Food was amazing service amazing. 5 stars

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Delicious food excellent wine list great service romantic ambience. Perfect

name: QueenVillage
review_content: We dined here for Valentine's Day. They were grossly overbooked for the number of tables they have. We arrived on time for our reservation to find more than a dozen people waiting ahead of us some waiting more than an hour past their own reserved times. We waited 30 minutes and were then seated in a hallway at a 2x2 foot table in the corner with chairs facing the wall with my chair up against an ice cold water pipe. The maitre d' was obviously stressed but unprofessional in his handling of the situation. When my fianc√© complained about the table he was crass and suggested either leaving or waiting indefinitely for another table to open. Ultimately we were moved and the rest of the dining was good on par with others in Little Italy.

name: amandah
review_content: We were in NY for a couple days and just so happened to be there for Valentines Day and wanted a nice little Italian dinnerThis definitely hit the spot! Igot the Veal Piccata which was ah-mazing my husband got some sort of stuffed chicken he couldn't put his fork down. The wine was lovely dinner and calamari app were delicious and we had the special dessert.The one thing I would warn people about is the table arrangements. The tables are set up just like your usual European restaurant-the tables are close together and they make sure to fill every space. We didn't mind and I'm quite used to that but I could tell by another time that was sat next to us they weren't happy. We loved this restaurant and will def go back for our next NY trip.

name: vday
review_content: The menu is perfect for picky eaters because they have just about every type of pasta and meat/seafood. The service on Valentine's Day was great--the servers and bus boys were attentive to orders and requests. The place itself got packed as the evening went on (as it should have on a special day) but it didn't get too loud that I couldn't hear my date so I suppose you can say the acoustics of the rooms are good. However I would suggest that they spice up the decorations of the rooms other than the main/garden room. Imagine going early to your reservation seeing that the place is still pretty much empty and hoping that you'd dine at the wonderful garden room but then getting seated in their side room away from the romantic ambience.

name: Dave
review_content: Not big on Italian food. Tasted average to me. However my fianc√© is huge on Italian and loved it. So its a woman pleaser my dudes

name: Kidoctr
review_content: Our experience was poor for only one reason. We had lunch on a Friday and were seated immediately. The restaurant is very nice - lots of food choices. The problem was my good friend's LIFE THREATENING tree nut allergy. She spoke with the waiter to let him know about her tree nut allergy. He replied by saying "What's that"? She explained what a tree nut was. There didn't seem to be a problem and she enjoyed her food safely but after her entree was served the waiter came by and said "I made sure they put extra walnuts in that". That was COMPLETELY INAPPROPRIATE. The last time my friend was inadvertantly exposed to tree nuts she went to the ICU and spent 3 days in the hospital. A severe food allergy is nothing to joke about.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: What a wonderful meal. Beautiful place outstanding food wonderful service. This place has everything we want in fine dinning. We will return.

name: DSB68
review_content: I have eaten at many places in Little Italy and this one has to be as good if not better than any of them. My companion and I had excellent food and wine and the service was over the top. The experience simply couldn't have been better.

name: Debbe
review_content: This was our 3rd time dining at Il Cortile. The service food ambiance are all outstanding!! Sal has been our waiter each time we've been there because after our first experience we request him! It's a wonderful experience and i would recommend it to everyone!!

name: jsap283
review_content: My boyfriend had never eaten in Little Italy before so we went this past Saturday. We had a lovely Italian meal. The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. It was 6:30 so still a little early for dinner so we got a perfect table and it wasn't crowded at all. Would definately go back.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Terrific service delicious food focused on customer service...great experience!

name: Bruce
review_content: Located in the heart of Little Italy we found the food and service were very good. We had reservations and were taken to our table immediately. The seafood and pasta dishes were excellent. The servers were attentive and there promptly when needed. Overall a very enjoyable dining experience

name: Jake
review_content: Great place made very welcome by the Host Waiter and Bus staff! Seated immeditately upon arrival at our reservation time.Waiter was outstanding as far as energy and promptness in taking our drink and food order.Bus staff was great as they were right there when needed and went over the top to make us feel comfortable! Now the Food!The Homemade Lobster Ravioli was to Die for! The dough was so light and melted in your mouth! The rest of our Entrees (Veal Marsalla and Seafood with Lingunni) were plentiful and delicious! The sauces with all the dishes were tasteful and not overbearing as most resturants are too creamy or buttery! Overall this was a great overall experience and excellent food so I would recommend to all!

name: Michaelr85
review_content: Really good food but service was poor to fair - granted we had a large gfroup on a crowded night but waiters were not friendly and management seemed not to careGood Little Italy experience but service counts

name: Scott
review_content: Impossible to get a table in little Italy around Christmas but open table opened a slot where others were turned away at the door. Monkfish was good and Sunday night pasta cavetelli with briole xcellent for southern style Italian.

name: kenp
review_content: I have been coming to this restaurant for over 15 years everytime I visit New York. The food is always great and served in true Italian spirit. This is an old scholl place. The only suggestion I would make is to expand the wine list. I love this place and will come back here for many more years to come.

name: TimR
review_content: The food was very good. The only problem was it took an hour to get it. Also my wife's steak was overdone and had to be returned. They did turn it around quickly though. The waiter was very apologetic explaining that there was a large party in the back but if they cater to them they should be able to handle it.

name: Foodlover
review_content: When it comes to authentic Italian food this is it. From the salad to the Veal and fish I have had none better. The wine list is small and is all Italian however an excellent selection of wines. The service was as good as it gets knowledgeable and never rushed. Our table was ready upon our arrival and it was a packed night with no tables available for the walk ins.

name: Dave
review_content: We were in New York for a short visit and wanted a great Italian dining experience and Il Cortile did not disappoint. We were greeted as though we were regulars the service was first rate and the food was terrific. A great all around experience.

name: melhams
review_content: We had a group of 11. Service was wonderful and food was even better! Will come back again next time we visit NYC!

name: CJC292
review_content: The food was outstanding. I will definitely dine there again

name: GREAT
review_content: Most of the food we got was bland and my sister's dish tasted like a whole container of salt was dropped in it. We won't return. Sorry.

name: Jake
review_content: Much too much noise. Would never go back. Awful experience.

name: FineDiner
review_content: We had another wonderful experience here this past weekend. Great food and good service (thank you Fabrizio!) Excellent suggestion on the wine too. We had a great table location and enjoyed ourselves fully. A little high on the salt content for those who need to watch their intake though.

name: mfrank
review_content: Pretty much everything we ate here was great. We got the stuffed pepper appetizer (Pepperoni Ripieni) was amazing highly recommend it. We also ordered the Pepite de Gnocchi (sooooo good highly recommend) the Spaghetti Bolognese and the special that day which was a rigatoni with spicy sausage and a creme sauce which was excellent. The only plate of food that we got that I thought was not good at all was the chicken parmigianna. I don't recommend getting this the chicken was dry and the breading did not have a good taste. Stick with the pastas because they are excellent. We also got dessert which was very good the cheesecake and the tiramisu. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

name: ThePlzPalate
review_content: We cannot count or describe all of the why's Il Cortile is a timeless favorite NOT 2 B MISSED!!! The freshest of ingredients and best cuts of meat are used for their delicious creations and consistent palate pleasers. And their signature veal valparrona is over the top but must be ordered 48 hours ahead.

name: DoreenJ
review_content: Need to get braised beef ravioli back on menu

name: JonniePolyester1
review_content: Booked a table here after discovering several of our first choices were packed to the gills already & so glad we did ( a lesson to be learnt here I feel). We loved being greeting by the charismatic maitre'd who was friendly & joked we could have his apartment upstairs when I asked if we could have a table with secluding lighting!Service was just great food delicious & even the Peroni beer was delicious unlike back in the UK. We had lovely shrimp in a salt & pepper coating & I had chicken in a lemon white & wine sauce. My girlfriend had some great spaghetti very fresh. The bottle of Montepulciano was the perfect accompaniment.Really enjoyed it the experience & service which contrasted well to other restaurants during our NYC stay.

name: Boe77
review_content: Great food and service just a little expensive more then I thought. But food was good.

name: Good
review_content: I live in New York City so I know the tourist traps and this is not one of them. You will be happily surprised. The food is great and the service the same. It is fast paced high volume place but worth it. The prices are very reasonable you can‚Äôt go wrong. Try it and you will be back. They have a full bar and a good wine list.

name: DahliaDoo
review_content: Being Italians and great cooks ourselves we are extremely picky about our Italian Restaurants. Il Cortile more than met our expectations. The pork chops with sweet peppers was OUTSTANDING . The Sunday Sauce special (braciole meatballs and sausage and rigatoni) brought us back to Nana's house. Caesar salad exceptional. Our service was attentive but not effusive We would definitely go back. We sat in the front near the entrance and the bar so the traffic gathering and kibitzing amongst the waiters and dinners was a little disruptive. Would ask for a different location on return.

name: NYCGirl
review_content: We were greeted and seated promptly our server came right over all of our questions about the menu were answered and suggestions by the wait staff were made the food was excellent tasty cooked to perfection and while we were waited on very very well they did not hover or interfere with conversation and volunteered to take photos of our little group so we could all be in the picture. I've eaten at this restaurant before and it never disappoints. I highly recommend it.

name: PLCSparky
review_content: We are in NYC every October and this is the best place we ate this year. Really enjoyed the sidewalk dining people watching and overall atmosphere. Food was exceptional. Highly recommend the veal chop! We will be back.

name: FUNCRNP
review_content: Food was fabulous....drinks were great!. Waiter was very friendly but communication lacking!Our appetizers came out very quickly waited a LONG time for meals to come one meal didn't come at all until I had to get the manager!I brought cupcakes for a birthday celebration it was obvious that the waiter had no idea...was very confusing as to what to do with the cupcakes.Overall had fun and great food for our celebration service a little lacking!

name: NYCJean
review_content: Never have we had a bad meal here. The taste is excellent and the service just fine. It WAS a little noisey but when we requested a different table they didn't hesitate to move us to a table nearer the entrance which was quiet and very pleasant. The wait staff was attentive but never pushy and they had no complaints when we asked for extra plates so we could share. The atmosphere was relaxing and altogether enjyable.

name: SFvisitor
review_content: Service exceptionally good we were made to feel that we could have anything we desired. We will add this to our list of "Little Italy favorites" and be back.

name: Michelle
review_content: The food was very good. The service was a little slower than I would like. Overall I enjoyed my dining experience because the food and wine were very tasty.

name: ILoveNY321
review_content: Went here on a Sat night with a group of 6. They don't sit you till all in the party is present but they have a nice waiting space upstairs. We appreciated that especially since it was the San Gennero Feast. Our waiter was ok. He never came to see if we needed refills in our drinks and if we needed something we had to track him down. Perhaps he was over worked and if so may have had to do with the feast. But the inside customers should still have great service with a fair going on outside. Inside prices were the same as any other day so perhaps extra wait staff on a busy weekend should be an option. I had international guests with us and their food was tasty their dining experience just ok.

name: Youknowme
review_content: The worst Italian restaurant I have ever been to. The service was horrible with a waiter that just drops and slams dishes and plates on the table like your at a truck stop or something. We ask for the manager who just started to argue with us and just walked away mid-sentance. They blamed the wait on a stuffed chicken dish that takes 25 min to cook. So I asked why did it take over an hour after appetizers for the mains to come out? By the way the chicken was as dry as a bone. Ugh

name: pharmasteve
review_content: There are plenty of restaurants in Little Italy to choose from and we were pleased we chose Il Cortile. Seating was very prompt and service attentive Our waiter helped us choose a wine and we picked an Italian cabernet sauvignon that was excellent. My wife had a pasta dish with a garlic sauce which was okay but the sauce too watery for her taste. I had a shrimp dish with prosciutto and pignole nuts with a creamy garlic sauce that was superb. The total bill was a little over $100 but half of that was for the wine. For New York City the cost was reasonable.

name: DebbieFan
review_content: My favorite restaurant on Mulberry Street since 1985. I always visit whenever I am in NYC for lunch or dinner. The atrium feeling in the rear dining room is lovely.

name: Jackie
review_content: A group of 7 of us went there on a Saturday night during San Gennarro. I made an 8 pm reservation. We ordered by 8:30 because they were quite busy and our starters came out around 8:45 pm. Our actual entrees didn't come out until 10:55 pm. Yes 10:55 pm. Nearly 3 hours after we sat down. The food was good but the time we spent waiting for our main course was unacceptable.When we tried to negotiate the check the manager was actually argumentative towards us. Bottom line good food but horrible service.

name: ken29
review_content: I ordered the filet and the meal was outstanding. Better than most steak places that I have been to. The sauce was excellent and I had two large pieces. We were seated outside it was fun because the San Gennaro Feast was going on. Next time we will request the atrium. Beautiful restaurant. can't wait to go back.

name: Couplewithkids
review_content: We found this place on yelp and tripadvisor and it turned out to be a great find. The food was delicious and came out fairly quickly. The atmosphere was romantic. We sat in a little atrium area with lots of natural light. I had the veal scallopine with hot peppers and my husband had chicken with peppers and asparagus and we both loved our meals.

name: Dotty
review_content: Absolutely delicious food from appetizers to dessert! Large portions...we shared appetizers! Our waiter was a lot of fun!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: 14 of ius - they did a gr8 job. Perfect in every way.

name: JJJCB
review_content: Great night great food. We ate leisurely and were never rushed out.Wine was filled without even knowing it. Professional staff and very clean.We always have our reunions here.

name: BigMFG
review_content: Great location in the summer to eat out side and people watch. Food is good not great and service is fast and efficient .

name: KRear
review_content: We went on a weekday with our teens during our NYC vacation. We had a reservation and got sat at a really nice table. the service was very good and the food authentic and delicious.

name: luv2eatout
review_content: We have been here many times. The food service and ambience never fails to be amazing.This is the only restaurant we go to in Little Italy!!We LOVE coming here!

name: Iron8chef
review_content: Excellent all around. This was a special occassion and we always go to Il Cortile for great food. Fabritzio was our waiter and he brought back such memories of Italy. This is by far the best restaurant in Little Italy.

name: RayandJ
review_content: Service and food are outstanding. The owner and the staff could not be more accommodating. I was there with a party of 8 and everyone raved about the food and atmosphere. I will definitely return.

name: Foodies
review_content: There were 3 of us that were dining. Two dinner entrees arrived. The fish for the third entree was delayed. 17 minutes went by and fish not there yet. The waiter was no where to be seen. We informed the host who was talking to a customer at the next table from us. he seemed rather annoyed that we were asking him to check on our meal. Five minutes later our meal arrived. The food was very good once it all came.

name: MeChaka
review_content: I hadn't had the opportunity to visit the restaurant for quite some time but was happy to find that the food and service was just as good as I remembered! If you're going to Little Italy I highly recommend Il Cortile!

name: Martin
review_content: The service was very slow and unattentive. We can get better Italian food from the local pizzeria. Shrimp was overlooked and lacked taste.

name: bengland
review_content: Many great choices on the menu. All of our dishes including a filet special and tortellini special were outstanding. The atrium area was quite nice and almost felt like you were dining in a garden area.

name: AtlTraveler
review_content: The food was good. The wine was outstanding (as was the service). It was a bit pricey for what you got. I will not be in a hurry to go back but I am glad we went.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Had an expensive and wonderful lunch outside at Il Cortlle. Great food service class and people watching.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I have not been to Il Cortile in about 10 years and was surprised at how casual it has become. There are no tablecloths on very old tables... They fold napkins and use them as pseudo placemats. The service started out fine but as the meal continued and the restaurant filled up it became clear they were under staffed and service was slow. The menu was very awkward because it was a huge piece of paper folded into 8ths and was difficult to follow. Food was great as always but I would try somewhere else next time. Too bad because this was one of my Little Italy favorites.

name: Suzamcq
review_content: We've been coming here for years each time we visit NY. The food is amazing! My husband had the veal chop special and said it was THE best veal chop he's ever had. The pasta is always fresh and simply wonderful. I had the chicken marsala this time w/a side of pasta. Can't beat the food. All of the folks are super friendly....our main waiter this time was below par but we won't hold it against the resto. He must have been having an off night as service is usually great.

name: DrSleep
review_content: It was our second time here. It is classic Little Italy but a bit on the expensive side for what you get. We got mainly pasta dishes and three appetizers for 6 people a 50 dollar bottle of wine and the bill was almost 300. Next time I will shop around for a better deal.

name: John
review_content: Best Italian food in Little Italy! Everything was fantastic.

name: Olivio
review_content: The chicken scallopini was the best I'd ever had!

name: Brenda
review_content: Whenever I'm in Little Italy I always eat at Il Cortile. Staff is attentive friendly professional and the food is outstanding. Staying in true Italian form they don't rush you through your meal. I cant' wait to go back again soon.

name: MNunez
review_content: I visited Il Cortile with my girlfriend of about one year. We went on Valentine's Day and had an excellent evening. The employees went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. The wine list is excellent. The seafood and past dishes were superb. This is a great spot to brink a date but I strongly recommend requesting a seat in the large room in the back.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great food. Like Mama in the kitchen making all your favorite Italian dishes! We go here quite often and we always have a terrific relaxing meal.

name: JHeinzerling
review_content: Don't order fish and god forbid an Italien restaurant have biscotti in addition to their 1950's laminated dessert menu.

name: LizM
review_content: We had high hopes for Il Cortile based on the reviews and we did find it to be friendly warm and the food to be tasty. However we were one of 3 tables at 7:30 p.m. so we would have expected a little flexibility. 2 of our 3 diners had some food restrictions/requests and the waiter was not willing to accomodate them or even ask the kitchen. The $17 seafood salad paled in comparison to what we've had at similar venues. The chicken marsala was tasty but didn't come with a side of pasta or potato- and there wasn't an option to add one. The food was good- the atmosphere is odd. While the glass enclosure is quite pretty the abundance of fake plants is not.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The Corvina a lo macho was wonderful and the service was great. Thanks!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: If you want a excellent meal in Little Italy I would recommend this restaurant. Food was tasteful and a adequate wine list

name: Egdiner
review_content: We had an excellent meal on New Year's Eve...service was great friendly attentive and very accomodating for our party of 9 with two children. Would recommend very highly.

name: PaulaK
review_content: Friendly attentive staff. Interesting specials. Good quality Italian food.

name: ElizabethT
review_content: Great food. I am Italian and picky when it comes to Italian food. Il Cortile was excellent. We were there for Christmas lunch and I will definitely eat there again next time I am in NY.

name: kk28
review_content: yummy reliable italian in little italy.

name: manhattancuit208
review_content: staff was rude and inattentive. We waited for 45 mintues before anyone came to table no one asked if we wanted anything to drink waited for 20 minutes for one person to receive appetizer while the other were finished. We would not return as this is the second time we have been treated this way and we live in Manhattan. Maybe they think that they can treat tourists this way because they will most likely not return?

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Fantastic experience great food

name: girlztrip
review_content: We've never been disappointed here. Took a group of 7 with two small children and everyone enjoyed. Beautiful setting!

name: LeeS38
review_content: It's been awhile since we went back to Little Italy. When coming back to my most vivid memories I remembered that Il Cortile was (and still is) one of the best restaurants down there. It happened that our waiter Fabrizio made our dinner even more pleasurable. Yes it can be touristy but being in a festive holiday-like atmosphere made the food tasted even better. The energy and fun of it all make this a definite "go-to" spot in the future. And priced reasonably as compared to the Upper East Side Italian Restaurants.Loved everything about the evening...

name: PhilipR
review_content: Fantastic food generous portions.

name: Pierre
review_content: A nice experience we loved it. Great service. We enjoyed every moment of it. We would return in a heart beat.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Food was absolutely delicious! Actual authentic Italian food. The service was good but our waiter seemed a bit done for the day. However the other staff was helpful. Will definitley return.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The best lobster ravioli anywhere ever!

name: Landmark
review_content: We have returned to Il Cortile many times and enjoy the food. This particular evening a group of people were sat beside us and that point our waiter totally ignored us. Very frustrating.

name: Johneboy
review_content: Il Cortile is generally the only place we go for dinner in Little Italy. Food is consistently outstanding. The service is usually very good - we always ask for Fabrizio. This time we requested him and they seated us in his section but then we had another waiter. Nice enough gentlemen but inconsistent. I ordered the chicken scarpariello and he wrinkled his nose and said "that will take 45 minutes." Not being in a particular rush I said fine and we ordered a bunch of appetizers (which are always small and expensive but we needed to kill some time). We weren't even done with all the appetizers before the food came out. Well most of the food - my son had to wait for his risotto. Dinner was worth the wait but the service was a miss.

name: Jess
review_content: Great food and service. A New York favorite.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Food was good not great. Everything ala carte so meal was very expensive for nothing out of the ordinary.

name: TRAVELBUG
review_content: We were told we had to have lunch here. The restaurant is beautiful - service is excellent but the food ... we were very disappointed. The Caesar salad although fresh made was very bland and had no cheese in it or if so we did not taste or see it? We both ordered the penne vodka with chicken and once again very bland. The sauce had absolutely no taste. At first I thought it was me but my girlfriend had the same thought. Nothing seemed to have any tasteand I'm not sure why. Maybe we just ordered the wrong thing. We were very underwhelmed.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Loved the service from an Italian waiter with charming attitude and culinary knowledge :)

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Il cortile was very good. We were a group of 8 and the risotto was a huge hit as was the linguini pescatore. I Especcially liked how menus were sealed and could be kept as a souvenir-very hygienic idea!!

name: JS68
review_content: Can not go wrong if in the mood for italian food.

name: Deegal
review_content: What a lovely retreat from the bustling crowds in Litte Italy. Yes they do have outside seating right on the streets where all the action is but the real Jem is the secret court yard they have in back. Sit down relax and enjoy a nice glass of wine or try their amazing Sangrria. It's the best D

name: FrequentDiner
review_content: Good food OK service. Not much of a wine list but the courtyard was a nice setting to dine in. Loud...but often to be expected in an Italian restaurant.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Entertaining out of town guests we chose Il Cortile for the great food in the Center of Little Italy. Every dish was superp the stuffed gnocci was a big hit. From the hot anitpasta and the scattiatta to all 7 entres Il Cortile is great. We will return soon. The waiters are very attentive as well.

name: DKNY
review_content: Sal is amazing- best waiter. He made the evening so entertaining. The food was great too. We will absolutely return

name: TableHopper
review_content: Getting to Little Italy from MidTown on a Saturday evening was a trek but Il Cortile was understanding and held the table for 45 minutes on a very busy night! The server Llosi was great. Our very chilled straight up "neat' martinis arrived pronto and our Caprese Bufala was a wonderful starter Marilyn's Grouper was one of the specials and she loved it. Veal Picata was my choice perfecto and the Chianti paired great. We wrapped it up with an espresso and a walk through NYC's Little Italy on a warm August night. What could be better?

name: Krissy
review_content: Enjoyable ambience and great food in Little Italy but the service was disappointing.  Other groups looked like they were satisfied with the service but my group felt ignored and passed-over.

name: Crissyb65
review_content: I adore this restaurant. I go here every time I am in NYC and can manage it. The staff are fantastic and the food is the best. I love the Linguine Alla Pescatora. No one does it better.

name: DailyDiner
review_content: First time back since our last visit to NYC 15 years ago. It made such an impression on us that we had to go back and boy were we pleased we did. Can't say enough good things about this place. I would go back tomorrow if I did not live out of the state.

name: Chris
review_content: This was our second trip to Il Cortile. The first time we had lunch and we were in a rush so couldn't order everything we wanted to. Since the food was delicious we decided to go back for dinner at another time. The food was still delicious but we were very disappointed that: a) we had to pay $8 extra to get a side dish of pasta (the Chef would NOT make substitutions) b) we could not get a glass of Pinot Noir and c) we could not get regular coffee (only cappucino or expresso). We left without having our long-anticipated dessert. With so many wonderful Italian restaurants in NYC to choose from we will not return to Il Cortile.

name: Bada3
review_content: Just a little disappointed - not as I remember it. Could be because we were a large crowd but that shouldn't kill it for me.

name: SuzanneD
review_content: Years ago this was an excellent dining experience.  Now just another Little Italy joint catering to the tourists.  Food was tasty but nothing special.  Service was oriented to moving you in and out without any grace.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Food was very good. We had a large group and it was perfect for us. The only negative was that the service was very slow - we were looking to take our time - but it was VERY slow.

name: AMinNY
review_content: We're a group of 10 people celebrating a birthday on a busy Sunday night. Each of us arrived at different times but the early ones were seated promptly to our table. We ordered calzones & calamari for appetizers and 5 different kinds of pasta (4 with red sauce & 1 white sauce) and chicken marsala. All very delicious. It's striking how with the red sauces each have it's own distinct taste apart from each other. Portions are big good for sharing. Waitstaff was helpful and always ready for our requests maitre'd was warm in welcoming us to the restaurant. Our bill came out to $300+ which is not bad for our big group and for the amount of food we ordered.We will definitely be back!

name: Vegas13
review_content: A must if you are visiting Little Italy!!!

name: MarkR
review_content: Really good pasta dishes and very nice wine list. Our party of 14 was seated quickly (with reservation) and served in a timely manner. The waiter seemed to be rushed at times and missed our drink re-orders but other than that service was good. We all had an entree about 6 appetizers for the table 3 salads several bottles of wine and a few drinks. Total of dinner was 800 plus tip which we considered pretty good considering NYC prices. Dessert was skipped because we had no room but the menu looked amazing. We will go back again for sure.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I've been to Il Cortile numerous times over the years and like everything on life it can't be perfect all the time it comes darn close all the time! The food never disappoints.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We had a outstanding experience.....food was great service was quick and entertaining

name: DCdiner
review_content: A hidden gem in Little Italy - a classy and authentic Italian dining experience.  It feels worlds away from the tourist traps that line the streets of Little Italy.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The cold antipasti was SKIMPY. The drinks were brought right away and then the waiter disappeared. WeAsked a busboy and another waiter for more water and bread. The entrees stuffed shrimp a little dry and chicken Milanese w eggplant and mozzarella (possibly) was good. None came w pasta. We orderedAnd split a linguine w garlic oil and both commentedIt was the best food on the table.

name: JamesS
review_content: Always consistently great Italian food and attentive service. The atrium room is wonderful.

name: One109
review_content: NOT GOOD

name: GHH1014
review_content: I was hesitant about going to Little Italy but Il Cortile was fantastic and exceeded all expectations. I felt compelled to write a review because I was so pleased with the restaurant. The food was delicious (fresh mozzarella and tomato salad was awesome especially) and the service was excellent and attentive. The dining room had a huge skylight and twinkle lights so it felt like we were dining outside with air conditioning on and without any of the street noise. We had reservations for 4 people at 7:30 on a Saturday night and there was no wait.

name: SaraF
review_content: Il Cortile was my Dad's favorite for years. As such I reserved a table in honor of father's day. Unfortunately the restaurant is no longer as extraordinary as we fondly remember it. The meal started off with a verbal offering of white wines including only pinot grigio or chardonnay. The chard tasted like a watered down sauv blanc. Trying the pinot grigio thereafter that option tasted like a sprite wine spritzer. If anything this was a prosecco and certainly not anything we were expecting or craving. Fortunately the food helped make up for the wine debacle. The menu is expansive and the specials are creative Italian. The antipasto was impressive while the white wine sauce over grouper was well done.

name: lynnf
review_content: We were seated inside near where the waiters place their orders. I wish we would have had a different spot. But we did get to hear all the behind the scenes fighting. Other than that I have no complaints. The food was delicious!

name: LucilleH
review_content: Always a treat to eat in Il Cortile. This time it was even better than I remember. We got fantastick service our waiter was wonderful. And the food was delicious everything very well prepared and top quality. I had the flounder franchise style it was delectable. Also very good was the pasta with peas prosciutto and mushrooms in a tomato cream. Also a special-- ravioli with lobster and cream sauce which was amazing. The restaurant was very accomodating it was a Thursday so they were was not overly busy and noise level was low.

name: Twigs
review_content: Our favorite Little Italy gem. Food and service always excellent.

name: BillH
review_content: Love the heck out of this place. Been here a couple of times in the past each time was very enjoyable and this last visit was even better! I went with co-workers this time on a Tuesday evening.We were seated in the rear of the restaurant which has a nice atrium roof - nice touch. We ordered the prosciutto and melon and a meatball for apps and both were enough for all 3 of us to share comfortably. Dinner was monkfish for one person I forget what the other person ordered and I got the stuffed pork tenderloin. It was stuffed with cheese and herbs and smothered with onions. All diners were 100% thrilled with their order. Cannot wait to go back and very highly recommend it to all!!!

name: Foodmaven
review_content: The food and service was very good but it took several tries to get the maitre d' to bother to check for my reservation.

name: Chris
review_content: We had a wonderful lunch before we headed off to the theatre. We dined in the indoor patio room which was cozy and away from the hustle and bustle up front. Our waiter Frank was so polite friendly and helpful. My friend ordered Sole and she is still raving about it. Also outstanding were the Gamberi Fritti Cortile chicken franchese and the Orecchiette Alla Norma pasta(which the chef was nice enough to make a pasta subsitution for me). Shrimp cocktail was not on the menu but our waiter Frank took care of it. We can't wait to return to this restaurant to try more delicious dishes. We recommend Il Cortile to anyone looking for a great dining spot in Little Italy!

name: scottsdalefoodie
review_content: We had a reservation for 5 people at 7:30pm on Saturday night. It was a bit confusing when we arrived as to who to follow or how to check in but after getting that squared away we waited for a short time and they had a table set up for us in the garden area in the back. It took forever to get service at our table but after we did get service the evening flowed pretty well.We had two people at the table have penne alla vodka one scallop dish one special fish dish and I had a shrimp dish. Everything was fantastic! So if you have sometime on your hands and would like to try some great italian food I would suggest this place!We would all go back again!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Thanks for the great tip! I used an online site to find restaurants near our hotel and then read the rave reviews for Il Cortile. A restaurant that has been 35 years in business - and with the same family - in what can be a very challenging business has to be doing something right! Two women dining together are often not given much attention but that is not true at Il Cortile! The scenic view we enjoyed was at an outdoor table on Mulberry Street enabling us to enjoy the energy of the street as well as "people watch"!We had a wonderful evening....

name: DominiqueO
review_content: Loved the house Chianti and the bread basket. Other than that I would say that our pasta dishes were good but not great. I also loved the courtyard table they gave us and I appreciated the relaxed food service.

name: Christopher
review_content: Had a wonderful dinner with excellent food and very attentive service. Will definitely go back the next time in NYC.

name: 2FastSkier
review_content: We have been going to Il Cortile since the early 80's and it has always been outstanding. This visit was no exception. Both food and service were everything we could ask for.

name: MMTT
review_content: Il Cortile has been a favorite for many years. The food is delicious and the service is always terrific. We enjoyed our lunch- so much food!

name: NY1FAMILY
review_content: Great find on a Saturday night in Little Italy. Food and service were very good. Very attentive waitstaff. Definitely recommend for families or romantic dinners.

name: Domi111
review_content: Wheelchair access is sorely needed. I love love love Il Cortile but being relegated to sidewalk dining in chilly weather is a drag.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: I took my 14 year old daughter there for her birthday after a long day of shopping. The staff were experienced professional and most of all warm and friendly. The food was amazing! Myself and my daughter are very particular about food and we couldn't have been happier. The dishes were authentic to it's culture and it was so good I almost ordered some to take home for the next day but didn't want to carry it on the train. We will definitely be back and will bring others next time as well!

name: Raymond
review_content: The food was great and the staff were so attentive!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Every bite at Il Cortile is amazing. We were giddy with delight in every item we ordered. The Hot/Cold Antipasto is a must order.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: My wife and I went there for our anniversary. It was a recommendation from a local. Food and Service was great. Nice atmosphere as well.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great Service Food was good Huge Menu The only down side was the wine list. Had a hard time deciding (limited menu.)

The ambiance and service were good but the food was just middle of the road. My salad was a little wilted and slimy. I had the scallops which were tasty but a touch over cooked. Others at our table had the pasta and loved it. Overall I would go back but think carefully about your order.

name: Closer
review_content: The food was good but not exceptional. The entrees were not too expensive but the appetizers were quite high. They didn't have regular coffee on the menu so you had to get the more expensive specialty coffees.

name: FiveYears
review_content: This restaurant offers a great reunion place. We had an awesome time and everything went great. The restaurant needs to work on their Pesto Pasta it was disappointing. The only thing that needs to improve. Great restaurant!!! Their Tiramisu and Lamb were to die for. Keep up Il Cortile...

name: queenlamb
review_content:
Food was excellent try the "Sunday Sauce",4,4,4,3,Dined on March 12 2012
Joseph,New York City,48 reviews,"This was my fourth vist to IL Cortile. The last time was about ten years ago and it is still a magnificent restaurant. The food is made with lots of care excellent presentation and of course extremly tasty. The wine list is not only great but affordable. Our Italian waiter was also outstanding entertaining and very attentive to our needs alomost like a mind reader. His assistants were also very good and we were not rushed to eat even though the restaurant was filling up! Will be returning real soon!

name: edchair
review_content: Il Cortile is a very good Italian restaurant in Little Italy. We have eaten there several times and found the food and service good each time.

name: Zach
review_content: We had a reservation for 7:30 we came at 7:40. We were directed to a bar to wait for our table and we noticed all others directed to the bar as well. By 8:15 with no table offered I asked for my bar tab with an intent to leave. Only then were we directed to a table in a room with many empty tables! Service was poor - a side dish was presented when we were almost done with our main course. Food is fair - certainly barely a 19 on a Zagat scale. This is a factory production restaurant strictly for tourists.

name: Jess
review_content: I went to Il Cortile last time I was in NY City based on a recommendation and came back because I enjoyed it so much. It was just as good this time.

name: Bellarmino
review_content: The restaurant was not very busy but the service was great and the food fabulous and not too expensive for all that we ordered.

name: NicoleA
review_content: Best restaurant I've been to in awhile. Wish the garden room was a bit more dimly lit.

name: GSKS
review_content: In one word "overpriced". Food quality was good and service was pleasant and attentive but the value for dollar was not there. Given the atmosphere and complexity of dishes your money is better spent at some of the finer restaurants in the city as this restaurant will cost you about just as much. Wine list is also quite limited.

name: BLF609
review_content: Well done Italian. Better than many of the Little Italy restaurants. Smallish wine list is a bit pricey.

name: Alsy
review_content: In my opinion best food in Little Italy with an atmosphere nicer than most.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great food with a fun staff. We had a group of 8 and were served with no issue. They were also willing to split the check at the end which is always nice.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great food great service Steven Maglio made it a fun time and our server Angelo could not have been better!

name: Brad
review_content: Great food and Italian ambiance. Huge filling portions.

name: Noname
review_content: I have been going to Il Cortile for years been to parties there had a party for my mom's 80th birthday there. LOVE IT. Great food high Italian no chicken parm here.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: The rudest restaurant I have ever visited. The Maitre'd sat two couples ahead of us who did not have a reservation despite the fact that I had one through Open Table. Then sitting at the bar and waiting the bar tender serves others who walk up after me...and trust me it's a small bar and I was the only one standing there until the other two folks showed up. Then a bus boy tries to take my wife purse from a sofa we were sitting at next to the bar. He tells me he thought someone had left it...I was sitting right there! We left. Terrible terrible experience.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great Place in Little Italy. The service was outstanding and the food was delicious! Two of our guest are avoiding oil dairy & salt and they did aTerrific job steaming extra vegetables for them! Our waiter was Sal and he was very helpful and accomidating.

name: adgal1
review_content: This and Il Mulino are my two favorite Italian restaurants in NYC... always fabulous!

name: HungryRich
review_content: Service was good for regular costumes only. Wait staff was very instinctive

name: Mellen
review_content: The restaurant came recommended- it was good just not the great we were expecting.

name: DebM
review_content: This restaurant was obviously trying to accomodate everyone that they could during the Christmas holidays. Unfortunately that made for a very chaotic atmosphere. Besides the noise simply from so many conversations there was some other background noise either from the restaurant sound system or from a child's toy that was loud and annoying. The wait staff was actually running from place to place. We were fed but that's about all I can say.

name: AlwaysHungry
review_content: Restaurant was so overbooked they put us in service bar area with no wait staff no attention. Airline waiting lounge comes to mind. After about 45 minutes we left. No one noticed no one cared.

name: SandyS
review_content: We have been to Il Cortile many times over the years and they NEVER disappoint. Everything we ordered was outstanding in terms of presentation quality and flavor. The best meatball EVER - you must ask for it as it does not appear on the menu. They pay attention to you but don't hover. View of inside square is a throwback to old NYC. The best meal and best value in a city of over-priced restaurants.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Have eaten here a number of times and as always the food and service are great

name: merylf
review_content: I have been to Il Cortile many times but not in the past several years. I was told by someone who recently dined there that it was not as good as it had been in the past. I would have to agree. I found the food to be no better than average.Also we had a reservation but still waited almost an hour for a table. We were a party of 6 (with a young child)and there was an open table for 6 people next to the table where they wanted to put us. They refused to let us take the other table. It sat empty. They had an 8:00 reservation for that table but the party wasn't there yet and they could have given them our table. It was not a great way to start. They should have apologized and offered a drink appetizer or something.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Fun little italy classic to take clients for lunch.

name: RRRR
review_content: Good for groups and holiday dinners!

name: Ronnie
review_content: The garden room was decorated for Christmas and was beautiful and spacious. The service was very good and the food was very tasty. A nice find in Little Italy.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Good food but overbooked. Reservation for 6.15 made table at 9.15. Held at door for approx 20-30 mins with no-one really giving any info simply passing by saying give me a few more minutes. Then taken to mezzanine level without this being explained as this was just a 'holding area' whilst further wait for table. People occasionally asked if we were from the party of 11 these had been complaining as their reservation was for 7.30

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Very noisy. Service was poor we waited for over an hour for our food and when it did come all of the pasta dishes were lukewarm. Specials were ok. Waiters were somewhat disinterested and hard to find. Overall I would not go there again nor would I reccomend this restaurant to anyone.

name: LoveGreatDining
review_content: Very busy which tells you the food is great. For intimate dining ask for the table in the front window.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Calamari appetizer was very good! We all ordered something different and everyone enjoyed their meal.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: if you MUST eat in Little Italy which I wouldn't really want to except when an out of town guest RAVES about a place they went on their last trip you could come here for some decent italian fare and good service.

name: NiceChoice
review_content: Friendly service and excellent food! More casual than I expected so no need to dress up. Very enjoyable dining experience.

name: luv2eatout
review_content: We LOVE this restaurant. Always great food and service. We were 9 people this time - they gave us a round table - which was wonderful - making it so easy to talk to each!! Everything was perfect. This has always been one of our favorite restaurants- and always will be!!!

name: diannew
review_content: would not dine here again....... the service ????? what service..... it was a very dissapointing experiance and would Not recommend it

name: edchair
review_content: We have eaten here before and each time the food was very good. The monkfish was the special seafood of the day. It was prepared in a tomato sauce with shrimp and was excellent. One of our party had the scallops and they were excellent as well. This is a very nice restaurant. I recommend it highly.

name: YankeeFred
review_content: this once fine restaurant has seen better days. Now it is surviving on the memories of better times---but still charging first class prices. Service on a not busy night was inattentive. The food was pedestrian with undercooked pasta and bland favorings. A spaghetti puttanesca normally a dish filled with spices left me yearning for a hint of taste. It was a very disappointing experience and one that will not be repeated. Dont waste your time.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: A group of 4 of us went for my boyfriend's birthday. The food was truly excellent and the portions were very good. The drinks were also very good. Unfortunately I found our waiter to be a bit rude and inattentive. All in all I would go back again and just hope for a different server.

name: Buzz
review_content: This was a wonderful experience. Food was fantastic and the service superb. My one note of discontent was in the wine list it was very very limited. Still with that I would visit again.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: ALL VERY GOOD. ONE OF THE MOST CONSISTENT RESTAURANTS IN NEW YORK

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great anniversary dinner...food delicious service just mediocre but overall was a great place for a great dinner.

name: Suzamcq
review_content: I have been coming to this restaurant for years and have been recommending it to all friends traveling to NYC. The food is always top notch (although the desserts have been lacking as of late). I've never had a bad meal here. Great fresh Italian food. LOVE IT!!!

name: DaveK
review_content: Made a reservation at 8pm for 8 people on a Saturday night. We were seated at 9pm. The food was phenomenal and the service exceptional. However I don't understand the concept of allowing a reservation at a certain time if it can't be fulfilled. Will be coming back but definitely without a large party.

name: manhattancuit208
review_content: the service was awful. We were never asked if we wanted drinks and after the entree the waiter brought the bill without asking whether we wanted coffee and dessert. I would not go back because there are many restaurants in Little Italy with equally good food and much better service. Who needs to have a dinner out with surley lazy service?

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: We were in town for the day and had asked a friend for a recommendation and he said that we had to go to Il Cortile- he was absolutely right. We had one of the best meals that with of us have ever had. We ordered the Clams "Oreganate" and Fettuccine Alfredo for appetizersand Gamberi Fantasia and Veal Scaloppine for our entrees. We were both just blown away. Our waiter was delightful and the "Garden Room" really transports you to another place.

name: LIH20RAT
review_content: This ismy favorite restaurant in little italy.  Even if I am staying uptown I will make the trip to this great place.  Sunday sauce is the best but you have to go on sunday.

name: drblynnware
review_content: Il Cortile continues to serve good and traditional Italian food with a flare. The veal and seafodd dishes we tried were exceptional. We ordered a bottle of wine at the server's recommendation and we didn't like it but he replaced thje bottloe with no hassle. Beware themj trying to "upsell" you on more appetizers and desserts than you want but otherwise a good experience.

name: Shanda
review_content: This was my third visit to il cortle and it was even better than the last time I ate there. We order several different dishes so we could all share and sample different entrees. The mozzarella cheese appetizer is divine. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I will visit this establishment every time I visit NYC.

name: charlesfiori
review_content: Great food decent service but the wine list selection is inadequate and way overpriced.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: This was the most miserable dining experience in my 8 years in New York. This place has devolved into a tourist trap with waiters who have complete disregard for the customers -- underscored by an intermidable wait for mediocre food. We ordered second glasses of wine that never arrived waited for an eternity between courses were never asked "how is everything" and realized that all of the tables around us were also being ignored. The shared frustration in the dining room was palpable. No one was enjoying themselves. We were all simply trapped. Never again.

name: adgal1
review_content: Fabulous all around!It seems"The Sopranos"cast feels the same wayas there's plaques by all their favorite tables.Big portionsgreat winesdelicious food and very friendly service. Will definitely go there again..next time for dinner!

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Just as good as the North End in Boston like home cooking I grew up with. Meatballs are to die for ! Veal metlted in my mouth so tender. Staff is friendly and outgoing. Great spot. Will come again my next trip to NYC.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Il Cortile never disappoints. We will definitely return. The antipasto was wonderful. We enjoyed the balsamic chicken with beautiful artichokes and the shrimp with spinach pine nuts and proscuitto. We sat in the garden room and the service was lovely. Enjoy.

name: JRAE
review_content: Been here before and had great food and great service but this past time we had HORRIBLE service. we ordered a bottle of wine and I had to eventually take the bottle up to the bar myself to get it opened.

name: susieq
review_content: Never disappointing. Love the seafood salad. And they have gluten free pasta!

name: Jerry
review_content: I have eaten in NY's Little Italy on a number of ocassions but this was my first trip to Il Cortile. It was not disappointing. The food was very good and the atmosphere quite nice. It was extremely hot outside so we dined inside which while a little disappointing worked out just fine. The service which started off very good disappeared as the meal progressed. Perhaps they were understaffed. But we would definitely go back again.

name: Suze
review_content: Extensive Menu great for groups. Great Service

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Our dishes were simple and enjoyable but perhaps overpriced. Our primary server did not particularly care about what he was doing.

name: dinner4two
review_content: I first dined at Il Cortile at the wedding celebration of a great friend. When I wanted to catch up with my best friend I decided Little Italy was the perfect place and Il Cortile is the perfect location to dine. My best friend immediately fell in love with the place. I'm so glad I returned. We shared two appetizers the seafood salad and the Gamberi Fritte ‚ÄúCortile‚Äù. For main courses I had the Fettuccine di Parma and she had the Spaghettini Puttanesca Speciali. For dessert we had the Tiramisu of course. I can't wait to go back. Everything was fresh and flavorful. It was a perfect meal in the perfect city with the perfect friend.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: excellent menu service and food. exactly what you would hope to find in Little Italy

name: KimberlyV
review_content: Extremely overpriced though the outdoor seating was delightful.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Great food. We asked our waiter to surprise us. Magnificent choices of pasta - stuffed gnocci lobster ravioli and daily specials. We would highly recommend and would dine there again.Ours was an important personal luncheon. We stayed for a long time and never felt like we were being pushed out.

name: FoodnFun
review_content: Great on the street in Little Italy especially for out-of-town guests. My nephew and his wife enjoyed it and we all thought the good was fresh very good.

name: JeffreyB
review_content: This is the best Italian Restaurant in NY. Used to bring clients here when lived in NY metro area and worked in NYC. Now for the last 16 years have been visiting when in NY for pleasure or business and the food and service have remained top notch.

name: Bummed
review_content: Depressingly mediocre food. Dingy atmosphere. A fight broke out between a waiter and maitre d in the dining room.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: It was good the chicken and bruschetta was a little over cooked but the rest of my party had no complaints. We ordered a round of get to know you drinks having not seen my sister in a long time got served and the waiter rushed in and in a loud NY way tried to push some very nice wine but please sir I just sat down have a full drink infront of me please let me relax enjoy my company my drink my time and absorb the atmosphere. Wine with dinner..... Mid dinner they filled the resturant with kids and regulars. The kids were loud in the echoing courtyard and the regulars were louder. I liked the place fabulous wine but can't say I would go again.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: My girlfriend really wanted to go to Little Italy for dinner and this seemed to be one of the highest rated places. As we walked through Little Italy and approached Il Cortile it did give an impression of being a step above the others. From an ambiance standpoint once inside it is a little dated and tired. It gives the air of a place that was once the place to be and now is kind of resting on its laurels. The service was great and our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The food was average. Overall we wern't too impressed. I would suggest not eating in Little Italy at all after our experience and just going there for dessert after to experience it.

name: Alina
review_content: I was completely satisfied with this restaurant. The ambiance servers food etc. were all marvelous. Their meatballs and fried mozzarella are to die for. I will NEVER eat fried mozzarella on the west coast again. A server named "Tony" was extra fun.

name: Sirdinealot
review_content: Food was delicious and service was outstanding! A true gem in Little Italy!

name: Letseat
review_content: I took my new son in law and his friend to Little Italy their first time there. We decided on Il Cortile and I was very happy that we did. All of our food was very good and eating outside in Little Italy is always fun. We are going to go back with friends.

name: Live2eat
review_content: This restaurant in Little Italy will transport you to Italy proper. Tony our waiter made us feel like family. We had a group of 20 and each of us was delighted with everything! We will never miss this when we are in New York.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_content: Very nice place delicious food but very pricey compared to the other restaurants in Little Italy. Went there to celebrate a birthday and read very good reviews about the restaurant. Food was delicious and the decor of the place was great but I wish the prices were a little lower. We all ordered the specials and it showed on the bill! If you compare the menus to the other Little Italy Restaurants this one is a little bit over-priced.

name: DeltaP
review_content: Il Cortile has good food decent price and good service. It was a good Italian meal in the states --- meaning - if you are looking for a true European experience with excellent plating hours of dining multiple courses etc this is not the place for you. However if you are looking for excellent Italian food and good service as a quick dinner after shopping/touristing all day this is perfect.

name: popupcheeseboard
review_content: Fantastic service great ambiance and a beautiful meal. The antipasto platter was beautiful and delicious a perfect way to start the meal. We finished with limoncello always the perfect finish to an Italian meal. The scallops I had were delicious topped with artichokes and cheese which was unique I had never had them that way before. My husband loved his veal parm as well.However I would have liked to have seen a bottle of champagne for under $140 it seemed a bit excessive. It would have been nice to have a $70-90 bottle since we were celebrating a special occasion and my husband felt the waiter kind of pressed him into ordering it.

name: luv2eatout
review_content: This is by far our favorite restaurant in Little Italy.We always love coming here. Great food beautiful restaurant and wonderful service.

name: Eatwithtoddler
review_content: The menu is fantastic so extensive and so delicous. The Back room although indoors with a glass roof felt like we were sitting in my favorite piazza in italy. Absolutely fantastic!

name: BrookynCliff
review_content: None of the above "special features" really apply.It's a lively somewhat noisy place in a good-humored way. Many regulars are greeted warmly by the staff. The food was perfectly nice the service efficient and friendly. It's nice that places like this with a history in Little Italy still exist. It's not unique or special though so we probably won't go back.

name: 3bullies
review_content: Very casual restaurant with good service and pleasing food. The area of town is wonderful to walk around and very enjoyable. We would definitely frequent this spot again in the future.

name: RBMGTW
review_content: Fairly expensive for very classic Italian fares.
